data.name: Description_Category_VoxelHands
data.value: The magic hands of a world shaper.

data.name: Description_Animation_Facepalm
data.value: Bury your face in your hands in exasperation.

data.name: Quote00Text
data.value: Had I been present at the Creation, I would have given some useful hints for the better ordering of the universe.

data.name: Quote01Text
data.value: Don’t depend too much on anyone in this world, because even your own shadow leaves you when you are in darkness.

data.name: Quote02Text
data.value: The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others.

data.name: Quote03Text
data.value: People pretend not to like grapes when the vines are too high for them to reach.

data.name: Quote04Text
data.value: Consider your origins: you were not made that you might live as brutes, but so as to follow virtue and knowledge.

data.name: Quote05Text
data.value: Remember what punishments befell us in this world when we ourselves did not cherish learning nor transmit it to other men.

data.name: Quote07Text
data.value: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players.

data.name: Quote08Text
data.value: It is easy to be brave behind a castle wall.

data.name: Quote10Text
data.value: He took over anger to intimidate subordinates, and in time anger took over him.

data.name: Quote11Text
data.value: Without knowledge action is useless and knowledge without action is futile.

data.name: Quote12Text
data.value: Run away from greatness and greatness will follow you.

data.name: Quote13Text
data.value: Good actions are a guard against the blows of adversity.

data.name: Quote14Text
data.value: Be at peace with your own soul, then heaven and earth will be at peace with you.

data.name: Quote15Text
data.value: Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.

data.name: Quote16Text
data.value: Oh, most valiant soldiers and descendants of invincible ancestors, be not degenerate, but recall the valor of your progenitors.

data.name: Quote17Text
data.value: If you bear the cross gladly, it will bear you.

data.name: Quote18Text
data.value: A man’s home is his castle.

data.name: Quote19Text
data.value: Only the artist, not the fool, discovers that which nature hides.

data.name: Quote20Text
data.value: If people knew how hard I worked to get my mastery, it wouldn't seem so wonderful at all.

data.name: Quote21Text
data.value: We come here with no peaceful intent, but ready for battle, determined to avenge our wrongs and set our country free. Let your masters come and attack us: we are ready to meet them beard to beard.

data.name: Quote22Text
data.value: I am not afraid; I was born to do this.

data.name: Quote23Text
data.value: Let no man who is not a Mathematician read the elements of my work.

data.name: Quote24Text
data.value: He who does not punish evil commands that it be done.

data.name: Quote25Text
data.value: Mechanics is the paradise of the mathematical sciences, because by means of it one comes to the fruits of mathematics.

data.name: Quote26Text
data.value: It is easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.

data.name: Quote27Text
data.value: Science is the observation of things possible, whether present or past; prescience is the knowledge of things which may come to pass, though but slowly.

data.name: Quote28Text
data.value: Wars do not just go away, they are only postponed to someone else's advantage.

data.name: Quote29Text
data.value: God is not willing to do everything, and thus take away our free will and that share of glory which belongs to us.

data.name: Quote30Text
data.value: Wars begin when you will, but they do not end when you please.

data.name: Quote31Author
data.value: Emperor Fredrick II, Holy Roman Empire

data.name: Quote31Text
data.value: He who defends everything defends nothing.

data.name: Quote32Text
data.value: For even he who is most greedy for knowledge can achieve no greater perfection than to be thoroughly aware of his own ignorance.

data.name: Quote33Text
data.value: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

data.name: Quote34Text
data.value: Nature never breaks her own laws.

data.name: Quote36Text
data.value: Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge.

data.name: Quote37Text
data.value: I have offended God and mankind because my work didn't reach the quality it should have.

data.name: Quote38Text
data.value: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.

data.name: Quote39Text
data.value: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.

data.name: Quote40Text
data.value: Mathematics is the language in which God has written the universe.

data.name: Quote41Text
data.value: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.

data.name: Quote42Text
data.value: I know one thing: that I know nothing.

data.name: Quote43Text
data.value: To the optimist, the glass is half full. To the pessimist, the glass is half empty. To the engineer, the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.

data.name: Quote44Text
data.value: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

data.name: Quote45Text
data.value: He who knows when he can fight and when he cannot, will be victorious.

data.name: Quote46Text
data.value: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.

data.name: Quote47Text
data.value: Confront them with annihilation, and they will then survive; plunge them into a deadly situation, and they will then live. When people fall into danger, they are then able to strive for victory.

data.name: Quote48Text
data.value: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.

data.name: Quote49Text
data.value: It is only the enlightened ruler and the wise general who will use the highest intelligence of the army for the purposes of spying, and thereby they achieve great results.

data.name: Quote50Text
data.value: If ignorant both of your enemy and yourself, you are certain to be in peril.

data.name: Quote51Text
data.value: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.

data.name: Quote52Text
data.value: I came, I saw, I conquered.

data.name: Quote53Text
data.value: Cowards die many times before their actual deaths.

data.name: Quote54Text
data.value: I love the name of honor, more than I fear death.

data.name: Quote55Text
data.value: Experience is the teacher of all things.

data.name: Quote56Text
data.value: There are no ordinary moments. There is always something going on.

data.name: Quote57Text
data.value: When you were born, you cried and the world rejoiced. Live your life so that when you die, the world cries and you rejoice.

data.name: Quote58Text
data.value: Certain things catch your eye, but pursue only those that capture your heart.

data.name: Quote59Text
data.value: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

data.name: Quote60Text
data.value: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.

data.name: Quote61Text
data.value: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.

data.name: Quote62Text
data.value: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.

data.name: Quote63Text
data.value: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

data.name: Description_Block_CatapultHead
data.value: The catapult bucket is a wooden bowl that is usually attached to siege equipment for throwing projectiles.

data.name: Description_Block_CatchBlock
data.value: A wooden axel mounting bracket with an embedded piece of axel. Used for creating rotating mechanisms.

data.name: Description_Block_LargeProjectile
data.value: A large spherical stone that is thrown against walls to destroy them.

data.name: Description_Block_LockCatchBlock
data.value: A wooden axel mounting bracket with an embedded piece of axel. It has a ratchet wheel and pawl so that it can be locked in a single direction. Used for creating rotating mechanisms.

data.name: Description_Block_Projectile
data.value: A small spherical stone that is thrown against walls to destroy them.

data.name: Description_Block_RopeDrum
data.value: Rope drums are used to wind in rope. They are used for pulling heavy objects such as farm marchinery.

data.name: Description_Crafting_RopeDrums
data.value: Rope drums and lockable rope drums are used to wind in rope. They are used for pulling heavy objects such as farm marchinery or throwing arms on siege equipment.

data.name: Description_Block_RopeEnding
data.value: Rope Eye Plates are attachment points for ropes that allow you to connect constructions together.

data.name: Description_Crafting_RopeEnding
data.value: Rope Eye Plates are attachment points for ropes that allow you to connect constructions together. Their variant, Rope Releases, are attachment points for ropes that release at a configurable angle, useful for siege equipment.

data.name: Description_Block_RopeTorsionSpring
data.value: A rope stretched across a frame that's been twisted by a piece of timber to create a spring.

data.name: Description_Block_TimberDiagonal
data.value: A diagonally cut piece of timber that can be used to build with or to produce many items and blocks. They can be crafted from logs.

data.name: Description_Block_TimberDiagonal_10
data.value: A diagonally cut piece of timber.

data.name: Description_Block_TurnWheelCross
data.value: A small wheel with handles for applying rotation.

data.name: Description_Block_Weight
data.value: A solid block of metal with great mass. These are often used as counterweights in siege equipment.

data.name: Description_Block_Wheel
data.value: The greatest invention since levers, the wheel rolls over the ground allowing you to move heavy objects!

data.name: Description_Block_WheelReinforced
data.value: A wooden wheel reinforced with metal ring on the edge.

data.name: Description_Block_WindMillBlade
data.value: An old fasioned blade from a windmill that can be used in the construction of more modern and functional windmills.

data.name: Description_Block_BonFire
data.value: A small ring of stones where you can make a fire for cooking.

data.name: Description_Block_FireBucket
data.value: A metal fire basket used for lighting.

data.name: Description_Block_TorchStand
data.value: A simple stand that holds a torch for lighting.

data.name: Description_Block_TorchOfTheAncestors
data.value: A weird, thin piece of metal. It's rather light and probably not usable as a weapon. People agree that it must be some weird kind of wall-mounted torch, but the flame is really hot...

data.name: Description_Block_WoodBarrel
data.value: A small barrel used for storage.

data.name: Description_Block_WoodBed
data.value: Beds are very important in medieval life. When you claim a bed as your own you will always remember how to get back to it with a little help from a compass. It is also where you can wake up, also known as respawning, after a bad dream about dying.

data.name: Description_Block_Wardrobe
data.value: A wardrobe where you can change your character's appearance.

data.name: Description_Block_WoodChest
data.value: A small chest used for storage.

data.name: Description_Block_CrateWood
data.value: This crate can store a large amount of the same item type, much like a stockpile. Unlike the stockpile however, a single crate can change its content type. Engineers using this crate mark the contents on the crate's front side.

data.name: Description_Block_WoodTable
data.value: A simple work table where you can craft items and small blocks.

data.name: Description_Block_KingStatue
data.value: Researched from scroll found in treasure chest.

data.name: Description_Block_BrazierHolyFire
data.value: Restores all stats and increases vigor to maximum. Use for organizing tournaments.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_HolyFire
data.value: Blessed fire doesn't hurt, but heals your wounds and give you energy to fight!

data.name: Description_Block_RopeRelease
data.value: >Rope Releases are attachment points for ropes that release at a configurable angle, useful for siege equipment.

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneBattlementSlopeLongMirrorLeftTop
data.value: Battlement Slope Long Mirrored Left Top

data.name: Description_Block_DrawingBoard
data.value: A table for crafting schematics that can be used to share your research with other engineers.

data.name: Description_Block_BlueprintControlBlock
data.value: The Blueprint Control Block allows you to place, manage, and browse your blueprints.

data.name: Description_Tag_HammerBuilding
data.value: Hammers are used to build all large blocks by engineers

data.name: Description_Block_TorchWall
data.value: A simple sconce that holds a torch for lighting.

data.name: Description_Block_BannerFaction
data.value: Your house banner is the symbol of your house that can be used to decorate buildings and constructions made by members of your house. Once you create or join a house you can edit this banner in the Banner Editor.

data.name: Description_Block_BannerPersonal
data.value: Your personal banner is your own symbol that can be used to decorate you buildings and constructions. You can edit this banner in the Banner Editor.

data.name: Description_Block_FlagFaction
data.value: Your house flag is the symbol of your house that can be used to decorate buildings and constructions made by members of your house. Once you create or join a house you can edit this flag in the Banner Editor.

data.name: Description_Crafting_FlagFaction
data.value: Your house flag or banner is the symbol of your house that can be used to decorate buildings and constructions made by members of your house. Once you create or join a house you can edit this flag or banner in the Banner Editor.

data.name: Description_Block_FlagPersonal
data.value: Your personal flag is your own symbol that can be used to decorate you buildings and constructions. You can edit this flag or banner in the Banner Editor.

data.name: Description_Crafting_FlagPersonal
data.value: Your personal flag or banner is your own symbol that can be used to decorate you buildings and constructions. You can edit this flag in the Banner Editor.

data.name: Description_Block_WoodChestLarge
data.value: A large chest used for storage.

data.name: Description_Tool_LandscapeStake
data.value: Landscape stakes can be placed in the ground or on blocks. When they are connected together with ropes they will form a plane that can be used with the shovel tool to create level or sloped ground. Planes are formed from triangles or squares. Any shape with more sides must be broken into more basic shapes.

data.name: Description_HouseHalfStoneDoubleWindows
data.value: Unusual window ornament. Researched from scroll found in treasure chest.

data.name: Description_Block_LockableDrum
data.value: Lockable rope drums are used to wind in rope, hold it, and then release it all at once. They are used for pulling back throwing arms on siege equipment and on cranes.

data.name: Description_Weapon_CrossbowWood
data.value: The simplest crossbow, made out of basic materials that is not very reliable. Crossbows can be used to hunt deer and fight enemies at a distance. Zoom in for maximum accuracy.

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeDoorOffsetBoth
data.value: Large Round Wall, Double Entrance Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeDoorOffsetLeft
data.value: Large Round Wall, Right Entrance Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeDoorOffsetRight
data.value: Large Round Wall, Left Entrance Offset

data.name: Description_Faction_Engineers
data.value: Association of craftsman trained in engineering. Engineers design, build, and maintain machines and structures.

data.name: Description_Faction_Barbarians
data.value: Wild and unkempt, Barbarians are always a threat to Engineers everywhere.

data.name: Description_Block_BannerWorkstation
data.value: A banner workstation can be used to customize your personal banner and your house banner. Note* You must create a house before you can edit a house banner.

data.name: Description_Block_WoodenDiningTable
data.value: A large table for the storage of food.

data.name: Description_Block_StockpileLogSmall
data.value: A small stockpile for storing logs. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: ContextMenu_Hue_Tooltip
data.value:
Hue
Position in degrees on the wheel of color. This allows a selection of red, green, blue, or a any combination of two colors. "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" to reset to 0.

data.name: ContextMenu_Saturation_Tooltip
data.value:
Saturation
Colorfulness relative to value. This means that, for a given value (set below), this controls the intensity of the color. This can be set to 0 for grey-scale. "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" to reset to 0.

data.name: ContextMenu_Value_Tooltip
data.value:
Value
The brightness relative to a similarly illuminated white. This means that a higher value will make a brighter color. This can be set to 0 for black. "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" to reset to 0.

data.name: ContextMenu_ResetColor_Tooltip
data.value: Resets the color to the original one.

data.name: ContextMenu_GiveIronKey_Tooltip
data.value: Iron Key: Give this person an iron key.

data.name: ContextMenu_GiveSilverKey_Tooltip
data.value: Silver Key: Give this person a silver key.

data.name: ContextMenu_GiveGoldKey_Tooltip
data.value: Gold Key: Give this person a gold key.

data.name: ContextMenu_ResetModel_Tooltip
data.value: Reset the character to the previous settings.

data.value: Change the yaw of the release to affect left/right position.

data.name: ContextMenu_Pitch_Tooltip
data.value: Change the pitch of the release to affect forward/back position.

data.name: ContextMenu_ReleaseAngle_Tooltip
data.value: Change the angle of the release to affect the timing.

data.name: ContextMenu_ConfigureRelease_Tooltip
data.value: Configure: Change the settings for the rope release.

data.name: Description_PlanetScenario
data.value: A planet with safe starting areas and caves that can be found and explored.

data.name: Description_Block_Skull
data.value: Decorative skulls taken from your defeated enemy.

data.name: Description_Block_StockpileTimberSmall
data.value: A small stockpile for storing any timbers and planks. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: Description_Block_CarvedPumpkin
data.value: A jack-o'-lantern (or jack o'lantern) is a carved pumpkin or turnip lantern, associated with the holiday of Halloween and named after the phenomenon of a strange light flickering over peat bogs, called will-o'-the-wisp or jack-o'-lantern. In a jack-o'-lantern, the top of the pumpkin or turnip is cut off to form a lid, the inside flesh is scooped out, and an image - usually a monstrous or comical face - is carved out of the rind to expose the hollow interior. To create the lantern effect, a light source is placed within before the lid is closed. The light source is traditionally a flame such as a candle or tea light. It is common to see jack-o'-lanterns on doorsteps and otherwise used as decorations prior to and on Halloween.

data.value: Large Round Wall, Double Door Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeRoundDoorOffsetLeft
data.value: Large Round Wall, Left Door Offset

data.value: Large Round Wall, Right Door Offset

data.value: Cast a steel ingot from dust

data.name: DisplayName_Crafting_IngotBronzeFromDust
data.value: Cast a bronze ingot from dust

data.name: Description_Block_Furnace
data.value: A furnace for smelting ores and melting metal items.

data.name: Description_Block_SmithingStation
data.value: A basic crafting station for making tools and weapons.

data.name: Description_Block_HarvesterBlock
data.value: A simple harvester for crops that can be attached to a cart or other mechanism.

data.name: Description_Block_PlowBlock
data.value: A simple plow to prepare soil for crops that can be attached to a cart or other mechanism.

data.name: Description_Block_SpinningWheel
data.value: A craftion station for turning flax into linen which has multiple uses.

data.name: Description_Block_SeedingBlock
data.value: A simple seeder for planting crops in prepared soil that can be attached to a cart or other mechanism.

data.name: Description_Block_ChristmasTree
data.value: Christmas trees are pretty and they make a good place to share presents!

data.name: Description_Item_Clay
data.value: Clay is a common type of sub-soil that forms below the topsoil layer. It can be used in construction or fired in a kiln to produce jars and tiles.

data.name: Description_Item_DustOre
data.value: Pieces of raw ore, smashed into fine dust. Smelting ingots from ore dust is much more efficient.

data.name: Description_Item_Ink
data.value: Ink is used for writing. It's particularly useful for conveying knowledge.

data.name: Description_Recipe_Vellum
data.value: Create blank scrolls out of vellum. Blank Scrolls can be used for drafting schematics.

data.name: Description_Recipe_Paper
data.value: Create blank scrolls out of paper. Blank Scrolls can be used for drafting schematics.

data.name: Description_Item_BlankScrolls
data.value: These are blank scrolls, waiting for a knowledgable person to scribe their wisdom upon them. Blank Scrolls can be used for drafting schematics.

data.name: Description_Block_MillStone
data.value: A basic and inefficient crafting station for grinding grains into flour or oil.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step01
data.value:
Welcome to the tutorial, engineer!
Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" to view the Quest Journal, where you can view and manage quests.
Right now you have only your empty hands. Gather some resources to make a stone axe! Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to pick things up.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step01_Short
data.value:
Welcome! Start by making a stone axe!
Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" to view the Quest Journal at any time. Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to pick things up.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step02
data.value:
It's time to craft a stone axe.
Press "[KEY:InventoryScreen]" to open your personal inventory and crafting screen. Crafting is on the left. Inventory is on the right.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step03
data.value:
Time to find a spot for your camp. Building near an ore deposit is more convenient.
Follow the pickaxe marker on the compass at the top center of your screen.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step03_Short
data.value: Follow the pickaxe marker on the compass.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step04
data.value:
You'll need wood to get started. Equip your axe and use "[KEY:ToolPrimary]" to chop down a tree. Be careful, falling trees are dangerous.
Cut the fallen tree into logs. Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to pick them up.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step04_Short
data.value: Press "[KEY:InventoryScreen]" to add your stone axe to the toolbar and equip it. Use "[KEY:ToolPrimary]" to swing it.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step06
data.value:
Equip a crafting table on your toolbar.
Use the controls below to position it and "[KEY:ToolPrimary]" to place it.
"[KEY:CubeRotateVerticalNeg]" or "[KEY:CubeRotateVerticalPos]" to rotate. "[KEY:CubeRotateRollPos]" or "[KEY:CubeRotateRollNeg]" to roll to the right or left. "[KEY:CubeRotateHorisontalPos]" or "[KEY:CubeRotateHorisontalNeg]" to roll away or toward.
Use "[KEY:MoveFurther]" and "[KEY:MoveCloser]" to change the distance.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step06_Short
data.value: "TAKE" the Crafting Table from the Crafting Queue and equip it on your toolbar. See the journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for rotation and distance controls.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step01
data.value: When hunger strikes, it is time to make some basic food. Eating raw food is not advised, since it will negatively affect your vigor. Starving will also hurt your vigor. Find some vegetables and fruits to prepare a salad.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step01_Short
data.value:
You are getting hungry!
You can eat raw foods but your vigor will decrease. Preparing meals is better for your health.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step02
data.value:
Press "[KEY:InventoryScreen]" to craft a salad.
Salads increase your vigor which affects all of your stats by boosting their maximum value and increasing tool speeds.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step03
data.value: Finally, satisfy your hunger and enjoy the freshly prepared salad. "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" the salad in the inventory to consume it, or drag it to the toolbar for quick access.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step03_Short
data.value: "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" the salad or drag it to the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step01
data.value: Gather wood to craft a bed. You will be able to respawn there when you die.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step02
data.value:
Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" while aiming at a Crafting Table to access its inventory.
Move a log to the crafting inventory to enable the Timber crafting recipe.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step03_Short
data.value:
The "+" symbol on the Timber icon indicates that it has variants. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" to learn more.
Access the Crafting Table again ("[KEY:CharacterUse]") and use the timbers to complete your task.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step03
data.value:
Block Variants: The timber icon has a "+" symbol in the corner of its icon. This means it has variants. You can change variants while a timber is equipped by using "[KEY:NextBlockVariant]" and "[KEY:PrevBlockVariant]".
You can also use timbers as crafting ingredients.
Access the Crafting Table again ("[KEY:CharacterUse]") and use the timbers to complete your task.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step04
data.value:
Move the bed to your personal inventory so that you can equip it.
If you make a mistake when you place the bed you can aim at it and hold down "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to pick it up again.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step05
data.value:
You must claim the bed as your own to respawn there. You can only have one bed at a time.
Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" while aiming at the bed to claim it.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step05_Short
data.value: Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" while aiming at the top of the bed to claim it.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step01
data.value: You will want to craft a Small Chest to keep your camp organized.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step02
data.value: Small Chests can be crafted at Crafting Tables.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step03
data.value: Chests are versatile because they can store many kinds of items. This differs from the larger stockpiles that allow only a single item type to be stored.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step04
data.value: You will not be able to store Timbers in chests. You will need to craft a stockpile specifically for Timbers.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step05
data.value: Store your remaining timbers in the Small Stockpile for Lumber. The timbers will be visible inside of the block.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step06
data.value:
Crafting is great for small blocks but now it's time to build a large block! Start with a single support block.
You will need to craft a Mallet to construct it.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step06_Short
data.value: You will need to craft a Mallet to construct a large Support.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step07
data.value:
Press "[KEY:SearchScreen]" to open the General Search. This screen is where you can find blocks and add them to your toolbar.
Add the support to your toolbar by dragging the icon there or using "[KEY:SecondaryClick]". Equip the Support and place it somewhere ideal to start building a house.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step07_Short
data.value:
Press "[KEY:SearchScreen]" to open the General Search screen and add the Support block to your toolbar.
View the Quest Log ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for more detailed instructions.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step08
data.value:
This is a construction stage where components can be added to complete the block.
Add the mallet to your toolbar, from your inventory or the General Search, and equip it. Aim at the Support and use "[KEY:PrimaryClick]" to build it.

data.name: Description_Quest_SpringCleaning_Step08_Short
data.value: Equip a Mallet and use it to complete the block.

data.name: Description_Quest_BrighterTomorrow_Step01
data.value:
Tutorial complete!
Open the research screen ("[KEY:ResearchScreen]") to unlock additional blocks.

data.name: Description_DeerPlaque
data.value: Mount your trophy antlers to display on the wall!

data.name: Description_Block_WeaponRack
data.value: A small rack with room for eight appropriately sized tools and weapons.

data.name: Description_Block_Bookshelf
data.value: A small set of shelves used for the storage of scrolls and schematics.

data.name: ActionHint_GatherPumpkins
data.value: Press {0} to pick up a pumpkin.

data.name: ActionHint_GatherBerries
data.value: Press {0} to gather from the berry bush.

data.name: ActionHint_GatherPumpkin
data.value: Press {0} to pick up a pumpkin.

data.name: ActionHint_GatherSmallTree
data.value: Press {0} to harvest the small tree.

data.name: Description_Block_Stockpile_Timber
data.value: A large stockpile for storing any timbers and planks. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: Description_Block_Stockpile_Log
data.value: A large stockpile for storing logs. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_GUI
data.value: Controls used for interaction in GUI.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_General
data.value: General controls used to access and navigate menu screens.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Character
data.value: Character-related controls used to move and interact with the world.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Tools
data.value: Controls for using/equipping tools and weapons.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Building
data.value: Controls used to place and manipulate blocks in the world..

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Spectator
data.value: Controls used to control the spectator view.

data.name: Description_Block_SimpleTable
data.value: A small table for the storage of food.

data.name: Description_Block_WoodenShelf
data.value: A small wall-mounted shelf used for storage.

data.name: Description_Block_Stockpile_Stone
data.value: A large stockpile for storing stones of any size. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: Description_Block_StockpileIronSmall
data.value: A small stockpile for ores. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: Description_Control_PrimaryClick
data.value: The primary button used to click on things in menus.

data.name: Description_Control_SecondaryClick
data.value: The secondary button used to click on things in menus.

data.name: Description_Control_Confirm
data.value: This is a contextual action. Examples of use are opening/closing a dropdown box, toggling a check box, or pressing a button.

data.name: Description_Control_CloseScreen
data.value: This is the same as clicking the X at the top right of the screen.

data.name: Description_Control_ShareInput
data.value: This is used to override default input to access debug controls with the mouse.

data.name: Description_Control_ScrollUp
data.value: This is used to scroll up lists with the mouse.

data.name: Description_Control_ScrollDown
data.value: This is used to scroll down lists with the mouse.

data.name: Description_Control_PreviousPage
data.value: This is used to scroll back one page with the keyboard.

data.name: Description_Control_NextPage
data.value: This is used to scroll forward one page with the keyboard.

data.name: Description_Control_Home
data.value: This is used to return a list to the first item.

data.name: Description_Control_MainMenu
data.value: Open the main menu screen while playing the game. The main menu can be used to save or load a world, change game options, exit from the world, read the news, or report a bug.

data.name: Description_Control_Blueprints
data.value: Open the blueprints screen while playing the game. The blueprints screen can be used to access and edit your blueprints library, choose blueprints to add to the world, or publish blueprints to the steam workshop.

data.name: Description_Control_AdminMenu
data.value: Open the medieval master screen while playing the game. The medieval master screen contains controls for editing the world. *You will need to be a world administrator if you are connected to a multiplayer server or dedicated server.

data.name: Description_Control_SpawnItemMenu
data.value: Open the spawn item screen while playing the game. The spawn item screen allows you to specify a quantity of items to add to the world or directly to the character's inventory. *You will need to be in creative mode or have medieval master enabled.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarConfig
data.value: Open the toolbar configuration screen while playing the game. The toolbar configuration screen allows items to be added or removed from the toolbars. It shows the blocks that can be placed in the current world with the exception of craftable blocks when playing in survival.

data.name: Description_Control_FactionsScreen
data.value: Open the House configuration screen while playing the game. The House configuration screen allows for creation and joining of Houses.

data.name: Description_Control_PlayersScreen
data.value: Open the player list while playing the game. The player list contains all of the players connected to the current game, as well as controls to promote players to administrator, invite new players, kick players, or mute player's voice chat.

data.name: Description_Control_InventoryScreen
data.value: Open the character inventory screen. The character inventory screen can be used to drop inventory items, add inventory items to the toolbars, or craft new items.

data.name: Description_Control_HelpScreen
data.value: Open the help screen. The help screen displays a list of controls and their key bindings.

data.name: Description_Control_PauseGame
data.value: Pause the game. This is only available for single player.

data.name: Description_Control_TakeScreenshot
data.value: Take a screenshot of the game. The screenshot will be saved to %appdata%\MedievalEngineers\Screenshots\

data.name: Description_Control_ToggleHud
data.value: Toggle the HUD visibility. This feature is most useful for making videos or screenshots with external applications.

data.name: Description_Control_ChatScreen
data.value: Open the chat screen while in the game. The chat screen allows you to send text messages to other characters in the same world.

data.name: Description_Control_ChatCommand
data.value: Open the chat screen while in the game with the / in the chat.

data.name: Description_Control_ChatQuickReply
data.value: Open the chat screen while in the game to quickly reply to the last player who sent you a private message.

data.name: Description_Control_VoiceChat
data.value: Hold to enable voice chat while in the game. Voice chat is range based. This means that the farther a chatting character is from another character, the lower the characters volume will be for the other character.

data.name: Description_Control_MapScreen
data.value: Open the map screen while playing the game. The map screen shows information about character and building locations, as well as provides information about on-going events, and provides access to fast travel.

data.name: Description_Control_QuestLog
data.value: Open the quest journal while in the game. The quest journal has controls for choosing the active quest and abandoning the active quest.

data.name: Description_Control_ClipboardCut
data.value: Cut an item or block(s) from the world and stores it in the clipboard. Cut is only available in creative mode or with medieval master enabled.

data.name: Description_Control_ClipboardCopy
data.value: Copy an item or block(s) from the world and stores it in the clipboard. Also equips the copied item to be pasted immediately.

data.name: Description_Control_ClipboardPaste
data.value: Paste an item or block(s) from the clipboard into the world.

data.name: Description_Control_QuickSave
data.value: Quick save makes a normal save of the world without the need to use the main menu.

data.name: Description_Control_QuickLoadReconnect
data.value: Quick load opens the last save without the need to use the main menu.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveForward
data.value: Move the character in a forward direction.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveBackward
data.value: Move the character in a backward direction.

data.name: Description_Control_StrafeLeft
data.value: Move the character to the left in a strafing movement.

data.name: Description_Control_StrafeRight
data.value: Move the character to the right in a strafing movement.

data.name: Description_Control_AutoForward
data.value: Move the character forward until auto-walk is pressed again or an interrupting movement key is pressed.

data.name: Description_Control_Crouch
data.value: Make the character crouch to fit in smaller spaces or hide behind objects.

data.name: Description_Control_Jump
data.value: Make the character jump into the air.

data.name: Description_Control_CharacterFly
data.value: Turn the flight ability on / off.

data.name: Description_Control_CharacterUse
data.value: Use or interact with the object that the character is looking at.

data.name: Description_Control_CharacterTorch
data.value: Equip a torch if it is available in the character's inventory or unequip an already equipped torch.

data.name: Description_Control_CameraSwitch
data.value: Switch the view to either 1st person perspective or 3rd person perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_Sprint
data.value: Run as fast as possible. This will consume stamina quickly.

data.name: Description_Control_Die
data.value: Some situations just cannot be escaped...

data.name: Description_Control_RollLeft
data.value: Roll to the left on the 3rd axis when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_RollRight
data.value: Roll to the right on the 3rd axis when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_PitchUp
data.value: Look higher when on the ground or pitch the character's body upwards when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_PitchDown
data.value: Look lower when on the ground or pitch the character's body downwards when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_YawLeft
data.value: Look to the left when on the ground or spin to the left when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_YawRight
data.value: Look to the right when on the ground or spin to the right when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_PitchAxis
data.value: The analog control for the vertical axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_YawAxis
data.value: The analog control for the horizontal axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_Zoom
data.value: The analog control for zooming in and out in third person camera.

data.name: Description_Control_Teleport
data.value: Teleports the character to the spectator camera's location. Teleport is only available in creative mode or when medieval master is enabled.

data.name: Description_Control_LookAround
data.value: Hold and use the analog controls to rotate the camer. In 1st person character view and free spectator view this will aim the camera. In 3rd person character view and follow spectator view this will rotate the camera around the character.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorNone
data.value: View from the character. Disables spectator mode.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorFree
data.value: Move spectator freely through the world. Use the mouse scroll wheel to adjust speed.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorForward
data.value: Move spectator forward in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorBackward
data.value: Move spectator backward in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorLeft
data.value: Move spectator left in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorRight
data.value: Move spectator right in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorDown
data.value: Move spectator down in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorUp
data.value: Move spectator up in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorRollLeft
data.value: Roll spectator left in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorRollRight
data.value: Roll spectator right in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorPitchAxis
data.value: The analog control for the spectator's vertical axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorYawAxis
data.value: The analog control for the spectator's horizontal axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateVerticalPos
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed vertially up from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateVerticalNeg
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed vertially down from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateHorisontalPos
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed horizontally to the right from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateHorisontalNeg
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed horizontally to the left from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateRollPos
data.value: Roll the block about to be placed to the right from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateRollNeg
data.value: Roll the block about to be placed to the left from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_NextBlockVariant
data.value: Switch to the next block variant. Some blocks are grouped together and indicated with a "+" icon. Each block in the group is called a variant as they are similar in function.

data.name: Description_Control_PrevBlockVariant
data.value: Switch to the previous block variant. Some blocks are grouped together and indicated with a "+" icon. Each block in the group is called a variant as they are similar in function.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveCloser
data.value: Move the block about to be placed closer to the character.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveFurther
data.value: Move the block about to be placed farther away from the character.

data.name: Description_Control_SwitchLeft
data.value: Select the previous material in the list. This is used in conjunction with the voxel tools.

data.name: Description_Control_SwitchRight
data.value: Select the next material in the list. This is used in conjunction with the voxel tools.

data.name: Description_Control_SwitchBuildingMode
data.value: Toggle gravity orientation or snap-to-grid while placing blocks or pasting blueprints.

data.name: Description_Control_CompoundBuilding
data.value: Hold to quickly switch compound mode to the opposite of its current setting.

data.name: Description_Control_PickBlock
data.value: Add the block or tool the character is aiming at to the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Control_StructuralIntergrityView
data.value: View the real-time structural integrity of buildings in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_CreateBlueprint
data.value: Add a blueprint of what the character is looking at to the blueprint library.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolPrimary
data.value: The main or first action of the tool or weapon. This is used for attacking, constructing, mining, etc.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolSecondary
data.value: The secondary action of the tool or weapon. This generally performs the opposite of the primary action.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolTertiary
data.value: Alternate function of the tool or weapon.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolModifier
data.value: Hold to alter the behavior of the selected tool. Only supported on some tools.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem1
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 1.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem2
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 2.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem3
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 3.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem4
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 4.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem5
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 5.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem6
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 6.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem7
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 7.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem8
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 8.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem9
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 9.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItemDeselect
data.value: Unequip toolbar item. This will remove the block placer from the characters view and allow for empty-hand actions such as picking things up to inventory, picking things up with the manipulation tool, and pulling things with the rope tool.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItemNext
data.value: Select the next item on the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItemPrev
data.value: Select the previous item on the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Item_WheatFlourSack
data.value: Flour sacks are produced by milling wheat straws. Flour can be cooked to make loaves of bread.

data.name: Description_Item_StoneSmall
data.value: Small stones can be found on the ground individually or in small groups. They can be found in the forest or on soil.

data.name: Description_Item_LargeStone
data.value: Large stones can be mined from the ground. They can only be produced from rocky ground.

data.name: Description_Item_DeerSkin
data.value: Deer Skin can be harvested from dead deer. It can be used to make tanned leather which has multiple uses.

data.name: Description_Item_Antlers
data.value: Antlers can be harvested only from dead deer.

data.name: Description_Item_FlaxStraws
data.value:
Flax is a flowering plant with blue petals.
Flax plants grow in grassy areas in the following biomes: Temperate Forest Steppe Rocky Desert Sandy Desert

data.name: Description_Item_WheatStraws
data.value:
Wheat is a tall grass that is golden yellow when it is ripe.
Wheat can be found growing in grassy areas of the following biomes: Temperate Forest Steppe

data.name: Description_Item_Log
data.value: Logs are used to produce many items and blocks. They can be harvested from trees in the forest by first cutting down the tree and then chopping it into logs.

data.name: Description_Item_BranchesPalmtree
data.value: Palm Branches are used as a substitute for Sticks. They can be gathered by cutting down palm trees. Palm Branches can also be used for thatch roofs.

data.name: Description_Item_BranchesBroadleaf
data.value: Oak Branches are used as a substitute for Sticks. They can be gathered by cutting down oak trees. Oak Branches can also be used for thatch roofs.

data.name: Description_Item_ScrapWoodBranches
data.value: Coniferous Branches are used as a substitute for Sticks. They can be gathered by cutting down coniferous trees. Coniferous Branches can also be used for thatch roofs.

data.name: Description_Item_WoodenSticks
data.value: Sticks are used to produce many items and blocks. They can be produced from logs and tree stumps. The more efficient way to acquire Sticks is to pick up small trees and plants. Branches can also be used as a substitute for Sticks.

data.name: Description_Item_Timber
data.value: Timbers can be used to build with or to produce many items and blocks. They can be crafted from logs.

data.name: Description_Item_TimberRound
data.value: Round Timbers can be used to build with or to produce many items and blocks. They can be crafted from logs.

data.name: Description_Item_MetalParts
data.value: Metal parts are used to craft items and blocks that use metal in their construction. They are crafted from ingots in a Smithy or Forge.

data.name: Description_Item_IronIngot
data.value: Iron Ingots are created by smelting Iron Ore in the Furnace. They are used to craft hard metal items in the Smithy or Forge.

data.name: Description_Rope_Basic
data.value: Rope is used by many blocks. It is crafted on the spinning wheel from Linen String.

data.name: Description_Item_LinenString
data.value: Linen String is used to craft bandages, cloth, and ropes. It is crafted on the spinning wheel from Flax Straws.

data.name: Description_Item_WheatFlourSack
data.value: Flour Sacks are used as an ingredient to cook bread. They are produced on the Mill Stone using Wheat Straws.

data.name: Description_Item_OreIron
data.value: A hard metal that can be smelted into ingots using a furnace. Iron can be used on its own to make strong tools and weapons but it can be combined with charcoal to form a more useful alloy - steel.

data.name: Description_DirtToSmallStones
data.value: Searching through dirt will often turn up some small stones that can be used for crafting.

data.name: Description_Item_CrossbowBolt
data.value: A bolt that is appropriate for use as ammunition in a crossbow. Each bolt is good for one use only.

data.name: Description_ItemTag_Ingot
data.value: An ingot made from any metal.

data.name: Description_VillageScenario
data.value: Planet with village and castle as starting area and also with caves to explore.

data.name: Description_Block_TrainingDummy
data.value: Used for practicing in combat and mastering your melee weapon skills.

data.name: Description_Weapon_Club
data.value: A crude melee weapon, the club is easy to produce but suffers from low durability.

data.name: Description_Weapon_SwordRustedBroken
data.value:
An unfortunate weapon, the broken sword inflicts little damage. Although it was once a durable weapon, the damage to the blade weakens it.
Swords can be used to damage friends and enemies. This usually results in their death.

data.name: Description_Tool_Crossbow
data.value: A strengthened crossbow, made with iron that is moderately reliable. Crossbows can be used to hunt deer and fight enemies at a distance. Zoom in for maximum accuracy.

data.name: Description_Weapon_Mace
data.value: A simple melee weapon, the mace is favored by barbarians. The metal in its construction gives it a higher durability than a simple club.

data.name: Description_Weapon_Sword
data.value:
A strong weapon for fighting, the iron sword is more durable than bronze swords. It can also do damage with greater efficiency.
Swords can be used to damage friends and enemies. This usually results in their death.

data.name: Description_Weapon_MaceIronFlangedEngraved
data.value: The flanged mace with engravings is a rare and sturdy weapon. Secrets of it's forging are feared to be lost.

data.name: Description_Item_ShieldKitePersonal
data.value:
Large kite shield, provides best protection and durability.
Represents personal banner.

data.name: Description_Item_ShieldKiteHouse
data.value:
Large kite shield, provides best protection and durability.
Represents house banner.

data.name: Description_Tool_WoodenMallet
data.value: A simple tool, the mallet is easy to produce. It suffers from low productivity and durability but it gets the job done. Mallets are used for construction and de-construction of large wooden structures. Mallets are not strong enough to construct stone structures.

data.name: Description_Tool_Hammer
data.value: A strong tool for construction, the iron hammer is more durable than copper and bronze hammers. It can also construct and de-construct with greater efficiency.

data.name: Description_Tool_HammerCopper
data.value: A Simple copper hammer that is superior to the mallet, but is still not very durable due to the softness of copper.

data.name: Description_Herring
data.value: An ultimate tool of tree chopping, the red herring is unmatched in its ability clear entire forests. Some engineers claim that the herring is so productive that it must be magic.

data.name: Description_Tool_HandPlow
data.value:
A strong tool for farming, the iron hand plow is more durable than copper and bronze hand plows. It can also till with greater efficiency.
Hand plows can be used to till soil and grassy areas. This makes the land farmable.

data.name: Description_Item_HandPlow
data.value: A tool for farming, the hand plow is used to till soil and grassy areas. This makes the land farmable.

data.name: Description_Rope_Basic
data.value: An easily understood tool, basic rope is strong and used to connect things together. It can be attached to rope endings and rope drums to tie or pull things.

data.name: Description_Rope_TearableRope
data.value: For more specific uses, tearable rope can tie things together but be easily torn when touched.

data.name: Description_Tool_WoodenShovel
data.value:
A tool with many uses, the wooden shovel can both add and remove dirt. Used in combination with landscaping stakes and rope, the shovel can be used to level dirt and create ramps. It's simple to craft but suffers from low durability.
Shovels can be used to dig dirt and clay from the ground. Loose ore found in soil near ore veins can also be collected by shovels but solid ore is too hard..

data.name: Description_Tool_IronShovel
data.value:
A strong tool for digging, the iron shovel is more efficient than copper and bronze shovels. It can also dig with greater efficiency.
Shovels can be used to dig dirt and clay from the ground. Loose ore found in soil near ore veins can also be collected by shovels but solid ore is too hard.

data.name: Description_Tool_CopperShovel
data.value:
A simple copper shovel that is superior to the wooden shovel, but is still not very durable due to the softness of copper.
Shovels can be used to dig dirt and clay from the ground. Loose ore found in soil near ore veins can also be collected by shovels but solid ore is too hard.

data.name: Description_Torch
data.value: Easily produced, torches can be carried to provide light. Their wooden construction means they are quickly consumed by their own fire.

data.name: Description_Tool_StoneAxe
data.value: The simplest tool, the stone axe can be made from nothing more than a stick and a stone. It will cut down a tree and make logs out of it with a lot of work. It has very little durability.

data.name: Description_Tool_IronAxe
data.value: A strong tool for woodcutting, the iron axe is more durable than copper and bronze axes. It can also fell trees and cut logs with greater efficiency.

data.name: Description_Tool_Pickaxe
data.value: A strong tool for mining, the iron pickaxe is more durable than copper and bronze pickaxes. It can also mine ore and stones with greater efficiency.

data.name: Description_Tool_SeedBag
data.value: A simple bag containing prepared seeds. These can be planted by hand or used in a mechanized seeder.

data.name: Description_Tool_SeedBagTree
data.value: A bag containing prepared tree seeds, gathered from branches. Used for reforestation or creating gardens.

data.name: Description_Tool_SeedBagHazel
data.value: A bag containing prepared bush saplings. Used for reforestation or creating gardens.

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeArrowSlitBoth
data.value: Large Round Wall, Double Arrow Slits

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeArrowSlitLeft
data.value: Large Round Wall, Right Arrow Slit

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeArrowSlitRight
data.value: Large Round Wall, Left Arrow Slit

data.name: Description_Block_StockpileStoneSmall
data.value: A small stockpile for storing stones of any size. The contents of stockpiles can be seen visually and they provide a a large inventory for certain types of items.

data.name: Description_Block_ArrowSign
data.value: Arrow shaped signs with icons and text.

data.name: Description_Block_Sign
data.value: Rectangular signs with icons and text.

data.name: Description_Block_Signs
data.value: Signs with an icon and text.

data.name: Description_Block_ArrowSigns
data.value: Arrow Signs with an icon and text.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_DeclareWar_Tooltip
data.value: Declaring war on another House flags them as enemies and makes their names show up in red.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_Surrender_Tooltip
data.value: Surrendering to another House is the first step to ending hostilities. They will still have to accept your surrender though.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_CancelSurrender_Tooltip
data.value: Retracting your surrender means that the enemy can no longer accept surrender, hostilities will continue.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_RejectSurrender_Tooltip
data.value: Rejecting a surrender means that you do wish to continue the war.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_AcceptSurrender_Tooltip
data.value: Accepting a surrender will end the war. Peace will return to the lands.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_ProposeAlliance_Tooltip
data.value: An alliance between Houses permits Fast Travel access. Members of allied Houses show up in blue.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_CancelAlliance_Tooltip
data.value: Cancelling an alliance means you will no longer be able to fast travel through each other's lands.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_CancelAllianceRequest_Tooltip
data.value: Cancelling the alliance request means the other party can no longer accept an alliance.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_RejectAllianceRequest_Tooltip
data.value: Rejecting an alliance request prevents others from fast travelling through your lands.

data.name: DisplayName_DiplomaticStatus_AcceptAllianceRequest_Tooltip
data.value: Accepting an alliance between Houses permits Fast Travel Access through each other's lands. Members of allied Houses show up in blue.

data.name: Description_CraftingCategory_Maps
data.value: All the treasure maps are in this category.

data.name: Description_MapTreasure
data.value:
This map was drawn a long time ago, looking a little closer you find these words. "Hid some useful goods in my stash. This map marks the location, don't lose it!"
Equip this map to track down the location and find what was hidden!

data.name: Description_JourneymansMap
data.value:
This map was drawn a long time ago, looking a little closer you find these words. "Hid some equipment to be sure the brigands don't take it. This map marks the location, don't lose it!"
Equip this map to track down the location and find what was hidden!

data.name: Description_ScribesMap
data.value:
This map was drawn a long time ago, looking a little closer you find these words. "Fellow brother, I have discovered some interesting ideas and wrote them down. You can find my notes at the marked location."
Equip this map to track down the location and find what was hidden!

data.name: Description_TradersMap
data.value:
This map was drawn a long time ago, looking a little closer you find these words. "I have received the agreed upon payment. The king shall tax these goods no longer, you can find them using this map."
Equip this map to track down the location and find what was hidden!

data.name: Description_Map_Piece
data.value: Part of an old map, looking closer you can read some of the words, but without the rest of the map you fear it is useless. More map pieces can be found under small stone piles or in barbarian loot.

data.name: Description_Block_Oven
data.value: The oven is used to bake bread and other delicious meals. Finished food will appear on the racks.

data.name: Description_Block_MillstoneMechanical
data.value:
Provided with a connection to mechanical power and an appropriate toolhead, the mechanical gristmill will grind grains to flour or oil. This process is both faster and more efficient than other crafting methods.
Insert a millstone toolhead to craft.

data.name: Description_Item_MillstoneCoarse
data.value:
Used to craft Flour from Wheat Straws. Insert into the 'Toolhead' slot of a Mechanical Gristmill.
Input: Wheat Straws. Output: Flour

data.name: Description_Item_MillstoneSmooth
data.value:
Used to fill Clay Jars with Linseed Oil from Flax Seeds. Insert into the 'Toolhead' slot of a Mechanical Gristmill.
Input: Clay Jars and Flax Seeds. Output: Linseed Oil

data.name: Description_Block_WindmillMechanical
data.value: The mechanical windmill converts wind into mechanical power. This mechanical power can be transferred through shafts and joints to run automated machinery.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWood
data.value: These shafts transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect other mechanical devices horizontally only.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodVertical
data.value: These shafts transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect other mechanical devices vertically only.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodWithFrame
data.value: These shafts transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect other mechanical devices horizontally only. The wooden frame increases its structural integrity.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodVerticalWithFrame
data.value: These shafts transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect other mechanical devices vertically only. The wooden frame increases its structural integrity.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodCornerDown
data.value: These joints transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect to other mechanical devices horizontally and vertically down.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodCornerDownWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to another. It connects to other mechanical devices horizontally and vertically down. The wooden frame increases its structural integrity.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodCornerUp
data.value: These joints transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect to other mechanical devices horizontally and vertically up.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodCornerUpWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to another. It connects to other mechanical devices horizontally and vertically up. The wooden frame increases its structural integrity.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodCorner
data.value: These joints transmit mechanical power from one place to another. They connect to other mechanical devices horizontally.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodCornerWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to another. It connects to other mechanical devices horizontally. The wooden frame increases its structural integrity.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodTWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to two others or vice versa. It connects to other mechanical devices horizontally.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodTUpWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to two others or vice versa. It connects to other mechanical devices horizontally and vertically up.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodTDownWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to two others or vice versa. It connects to other mechanical devices horizontally and vertically down.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodTVerticalWithFrame
data.value: This joint transmits mechanical power from one place to two others or vice versa. It connects to other mechanical devices vertically and horizontally.

data.name: Description_Item_Plank
data.value: Planks can be used to build with or to produce many items and blocks. They can be crafted from timbers.

data.name: Description_Block_Kiln
data.value: Kilns are used to craft items from clay.

data.name: Description_Item_Clay
data.value: Used for pottery or simple structures.

data.name: Description_Tool_AxeSteel
data.value: A superior axe in every way, the steel axe is the ultimate woodcutter's tool.

data.name: Description_Tool_HammerSteel
data.value: A superior hammer in every way, the steel hammer is the ultimate carpenter's tool.

data.name: Description_Tool_PickaxeSteel
data.value: A superior pickaxe in every way, the steel pickaxe is the ultimate miner's tool.

data.name: Description_Tool_ShovelSteel
data.value:
A superior shovel in every way, the steel shovel is the ultimate digging tool.
Shovels can be used to dig dirt and clay from the ground. Loose ore found in soil near ore veins can also be collected by shovels but solid ore is too hard.

data.name: Description_Weapon_SwordSteel
data.value:
A superior sword in every way, the steel sword is the ultimate fighting weapon.
Swords can be used to damage friends and enemies. This usually results in their death.

data.name: Description_Tool_AxeCopper
data.value: A simple copper axe is better than a primitive stone axe, but still not very durable due to the softness of copper.

data.name: Description_Tool_PickaxeCopper
data.value: A simple copper pickaxe can mine metals and stone, but is not very durable due to the softness of copper.

data.name: Description_Weapon_MaceCopper
data.value: A simple copper mace, more effective than club due to metal spikes.

data.name: Description_Tool_HandPlowCopper
data.value:
A simple copper hand plow that is not very durable due to the softness of copper.
Hand plows can be used to till soil and grassy areas. This makes the land farmable.

data.name: Description_Tool_HandPlowSteel
data.value:
A superior hand plow in every way, the steel hand plow is the ultimate farming tool.
Hand plows can be used to till soil and grassy areas. This makes the land farmable..

data.name: Description_Tool_AxeBronze
data.value: Although slightly more durable and efficient than a copper axe, the bronze axe still suffers from the softness of its alloy.

data.name: Description_Tool_HammerBronze
data.value: Although slightly more durable and efficient than a copper hammer, the bronze hammer still suffers from the softness of its alloy.

data.name: Description_Tool_PickaxeBronze
data.value: Although slightly more durable and efficient than a copper pickaxe, the bronze pickaxe still suffers from the softness of its alloy.

data.name: Description_Tool_ShovelBronze
data.value:
Although slightly more durable and efficient than a copper shovel, the bronze shovel still suffers from the softness of its alloy.
Shovels can be used to dig dirt and clay from the ground. Loose ore found in soil near ore veins can also be collected by shovels but solid ore is too hard.

data.name: Description_Tool_HandPlowBronze
data.value:
Although slightly more durable and efficient than a copper hand plow, the bronze hand plow still suffers from the softness of its alloy
Hand plows can be used to till soil and grassy areas. This makes the land farmable..

data.name: Description_Weapon_MaceBronze
data.value: Mace with bronze spikes makes it more effective.

data.name: Description_Weapon_SwordBronze
data.value:
A simple bronze sword that is not very durable due to the softness of its alloy.
Swords can be used to damage friends and enemies. This usually results in their death.

data.name: Description_Block_TanningRack
data.value: A crafting station for making leather and blank scrolls.

data.name: Description_Block_Forge
data.value: An advanced crafting station for making hardened tools and weapons.

data.name: Description_Item_Schematic
data.value: Scrolls that contain information about research. Consume a schematic to learn the knowledge.

data.name: Description_Item_RoofTileStack
data.value: Ceramic roofing tiles are used for building red tile roofs.

data.name: Description_Item_LeatherTanned
data.value: Tanned leather can be cut into strips suitable for weapon grips or dried to make blank scrolls.

data.name: Description_Item_JarClayWithLinseedOil
data.value: Linseed oil is used for steel quenching, moving parts lubrication and for crafting ink.

data.name: Description_Item_JarClay
data.value: Clay jars are simple containers used to contain liquids.

data.name: Description_EmptyPlanet
data.value: Blank planet start, could be used for modded planets.

data.name: Description_WildStart
data.value: Starting in wilds, no safe area. There are landmarks to explore.

data.name: Description_SafeAreaStart
data.value: Starting near safe area. There are landmarks to explore.

data.name: Description_ArenaStart
data.value: Starting next to an arena, where you can prove yourself in combat against other players. There are landmarks to explore.

data.name: Description_ResearchTree_MilitaryEngineering
data.value: Military Engineering includes all of the knowledge about defenses, weapons, siegecraft and other works of military importance.

data.name: Description_ResearchTree_CivilEngineering
data.value: Civil Engineering includes all of the knowledge about houses, storage and other works of civilian life.

data.name: Description_ResearchTree_EconomicEngineering
data.value: Economic Engineering includes all of the knowledge about agriculture, industry and other works of economy.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianClaimblockWood
data.value:
Learn how to build a claim block and take ownership of an area.
Owning an area allows you to set permissions within the area that control who can construct, mine, and spawn there.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianClaimblockWood
data.value:
Learn how to build a claim block and take ownership of an area.
Owning an area allows you to set permissions within the area that control who can construct, mine, and spawn there.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianClaimblockWood_Step01
data.value: It looks like you want to learn about civilian life. You'll have to figure out how to build a house, furnish your house, and engineer a way to store your supplies. Some of what you learn will include other types of engineering but only engineers who have learned about civilian life will know the best ways to make a home. Learning how to claim an area of land will allow you to control all of the buildings and resources on that land. You'll want to get started by gathering some wood to build a claim block.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianClaimblockWood_Step01_Short
data.value: It looks like you want to learn about civilian life. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" to learn more about what you'll be learning in this research branch. You'll want to get started on this quest by gathering some wood to build a claim block.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianClaimblockWood_Step02
data.value: Place the claim block on the area of land you want to own. While you are placing it, you will see a white border around the area. Finish building the claim block with a mallet. This will begin the process of laying claim to the land.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianClaimblockWood_Step03
data.value: Once your claim is successful you will be able to access the claim block by pressing "[KEY:CharacterUse]". The settings on the claim block give you control over area permissions, spawning permissions, area name, and taxes. Does this mean you get to charge people taxes? Well, that's between you and them. The claim block is where you go to pay taxes for owning the land. If you don't pay your taxes you can lose control of your area.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianClaimblockWood_Step03_Short
data.value: Once your claim is successful you will be able to access the claim block by pressing "[KEY:CharacterUse]". Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" to learn more about Claim Blocks.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianClaimblockWood
data.value: A document describing all of the details about building a claim block and taking ownership of an area.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicClaimblockWood
data.value:
Procedure for taking ownership of a land area.
Owning an area allows you to set permissions within the area that control who can construct, mine, and spawn there.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicClaimblockWood
data.value:
Procedure for taking ownership of a land area.
Owning an area allows you to set permissions within the area that control who can construct, mine, and spawn there.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicClaimblockWood_Step01
data.value: If you're interested in growing the economy by producing food and marketable goods then you may have what it takes to be an economic engineer. You'll have to learn to operate a mill, produce ceramics, and plant crops. Some of what you learn will include other types of engineering but only engineers who have learned how the economy works can produce the goods required for the economy to thrive. Learning how to take ownership of some land will allow you to control all of the buildings and resources on that land. You'll want to get started by gathering some wood to build a claim block.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicClaimblockWood_Step01_Short
data.value:
If you're interested in growing the economy by producing food and marketable goods then you may have what it takes to be an economic engineer. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information.
Learning how to take ownership of some land will allow you to control all of the buildings and resources on that land. You'll want to get started by gathering some wood to build a claim block.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicClaimblockWood_Step02
data.value: Place the claim block on the area of land you want to own. While you are placing it, you will see a white border around the area. Finish building the claim block with a mallet. This will begin the process of laying claim to the land.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicClaimblockWood_Step03
data.value: Once your claim is successful you will be able to access the claim block by pressing "[KEY:CharacterUse]". The settings on the claim block give you control over area permissions, spawning permissions, area name, and taxes. Does this mean you get to charge people taxes? Well, that's between you and them. The claim block is where you go to pay taxes for owning the land. If you don't pay your taxes you can lose control of your area.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicClaimblockWood_Step03_Short
data.value: Once your claim is successful you will be able to access the claim block by pressing "[KEY:CharacterUse]". The settings on the claim block give you control over area permissions, spawning permissions, area name, and taxes. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicClaimblockWood
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building a claim block and taking ownership of an area..

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianSmelting
data.value:
General techniques for mining ore and smelting the ore into ingots using a furnace.
Mining and creating ingots is required to produce metal components, tools, and weapons.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting
data.value:
General techniques for mining ore and smelting the ore into ingots using a furnace.
Mining and creating ingots is required to produce metal components, tools, and weapons.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianSmelting
data.value: A document describing all of the details of mining ore, building a furnace, and smelting the ore into ingots.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step00
data.value: Learning how to smelt metals will help you make tools and metal parts. You'll want to dig for some ore to get started so gather resources to make a shovel.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step01
data.value: Craft a wooden shovel. You'll need it to gather ore. Wooden shovels can be crafted in your inventory or at a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step02
data.value: You need some clay and small stones to craft a furnace. Clay can be found underground almost everywhere, especially where grass is.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step03
data.value: You need a furnace to smelt the ore. You can craft a furnace using a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step04
data.value: You are prepared for smelting but you don't have any ore. Go to a nearby deposit.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step05
data.value: There is ore in the ground here. Hopefully you still have your shovel with you because it's time to start digging!

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSmelting_Step06
data.value: So now you have some metal ore. Good job! Use the furnace to craft your first ingot. Furnaces operate like crafting tables except they require fuel and the fire can be lit and doused. Many different items can be burnt for fuel.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianWoodenHouse
data.value:
Basic house construction techniques to build a wooden foundation, floors, and walls.
These techniques can be used to build any basic wooden structure.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse
data.value:
Basic house construction techniques to build a wooden foundation, floors, and walls.
These techniques can be used to build any basic wooden structure.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianWoodenHouse
data.value: A document describing construction techniques to create a foundation, floors, and walls of a basic wooden house.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step01
data.value: It takes a lot of wood to build a house. Start by gathering supplies.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step02
data.value: This is the moment you've been waiting for. It's time to begin construction of your house. Try to construct some wooden stairs where you want the entrance to your house to be. This will make it easer to get in and out during construction.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step03
data.value: You'll want to build wooden supports under your house. This will give you a solid foundation and a level place to build a floor. Start from your stairs and construct supports in the shape you want your house to take.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step03_Complete
data.value: Ready to start adding the floor!

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step04
data.value: You can start constructing floors on top of the supports. To attach the floors to the top of the supports you may need to turn off compound building mode. This prevents you from overlaping some blocks in the same space. Press "[KEY:SwitchCompoundBuilding]" to toggle compound building mode on/off or hold "[KEY:CompoundBuilding]" to disable it momentarily.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step04_Short
data.value: You can start constructing floors on top of the supports. NOTE: Turn off compound building mode. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for instructions.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step05
