data.value: Equip the wall available in the general search ("[KEY:SearchScreen]"). Most walls only rotate around their vertical axis but this one can also be rotated on another axis. You'll want to place walls on top of the floors. This will require compound building mode be turned on so that the walls and floors can share the same space. Go ahead and try building a few. Make sure you don't block access to your stairs!

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse_Step05_Short
data.value: Equip the wall available in the general search ("[KEY:SearchScreen]"). Turn on compound building mode to place walls on top of the floors. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianFurniture
data.value:
Techniques for making basic decorative furnishings for your house and castle.
Decorate with tables, chairs, shelves and various signs.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture
data.value:
Techniques for making basic decorative furnishings for your house and castle.
Decorate with tables, chairs, shelves and various signs.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianFurniture
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making basic signs and furniture for your house and castle.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture_Step01
data.value: Start by gathering some planks to make signs.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture_Step02
data.value: Signs are a good way to keep things organized or put labels on your constructions. Use a crafting table to create a sign.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture_Step03
data.value: Place a sign somewhere. Note that you can put any text you want on it and even add an image on the background. Don't forget to click ok when adding text.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture_Step04
data.value: Simple tables are not only decorative but are also convenient to store food and small items. Items placed in the table's inventory will appear visually on the table!

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianLargeStockpiles
data.value:
Better stockpiling techniques that will allow you to build larger stockpiles for your building supplies.
Use these techniques to create large stockpiles for stones, logs, or timbers.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianLargeStockpiles
data.value:
Better stockpiling techniques that will allow you to build larger stockpiles for your building supplies.
Use these techniques to create large stockpiles for stones, logs, or timbers.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianLargeStockpiles
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building large storage stockpiles.

data.name: Description_Quest_LargeStockpile_Step01
data.value: Start by gathering some components to build a large stockpile.

data.name: Description_Quest_LargeStockpile_Step02
data.value: It's nice to have more resources ready when you need them. The easiest way to do that is to build large stockpiles to hold more resources. Logs are a good basic resource to start with.

data.name: Description_Quest_LargeStockpile_Step03
data.value: One of the main products of logs is timbers. You'll probably make a lot of timbers and it's good to have a place to stockpile those as well. Gather the resources you need to make a lumber stockpile. If you have trouble finding wheat straws look in grasslands.

data.name: Description_Quest_LargeStockpile_Step04
data.value: Find a place to put your lumber stockpile. Convenient places are near your log stockpile or next to a construction site. Keep resources close to make building easier.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianMetalTools
data.value:
Details and techniques to make a variety of tools using available metals.
Make a hammer and an axe, pickaxe, or metal shovel with increased durability and efficiency.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools
data.value:
Details and techniques to make a variety of tools using available metals.
Make a hammer and an axe, pickaxe, or metal shovel with increased durability and efficiency.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianMetalTools
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making metal tools.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools_Step01
data.value: Metal tools are crafted on a smithy or forge. Gather resources to craft a smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools_Step01_Active
data.value: • Gather 8x Copper Ingots or Iron Ingots

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools_Step02
data.value: Metal tools have to be hammered on an anvil at a smithy or forge. If you don't have one of these then you will have to craft one at a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools_Step03
data.value: A common item created at a smithy is metal parts. These are used as components in torch stands, doors and more complex blocks. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools_Step04
data.value: Metal tools are more efficient and durable than wooden ones. Craft a metal tool that you would like.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianMetalTools_Step04_ToolActive
data.value: Craft 1 Hammer, Axe, Pickaxe, or metal Shovel.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianWoodenHouse2
data.value:
Use Plank Walls and Wooden Roofs to build a better house.
Small Stairs and Wall-Walks can be used as improvised scaffolding to climb to the top of any structure.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2
data.value:
Use Plank Walls and Wooden Roofs to build a better house.
Small Stairs and Wall-Walks can be used as improvised scaffolding to climb to the top of any structure.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianWoodenHouse2
data.value: A document describing how to build Plank Walls and Wooden Roofs.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2_Step01
data.value: Start by gathering some components to build Plank Walls and "scaffolding".

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2_Step02
data.value: Plank walls are higher quality than Log Walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2_Step03
data.value: Building Higher can seem challenging but placing some stairs and Wall-Walks as "scaffolding" makes it easy. Start with some Small Stairs on an outside wall and don't forget to leave room near the top of the stairs for the Wall-Walk.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2_Step04
data.value: Climb the Small Stairs and build a Wall-Walk to stand on.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2_Step05
data.value: Now that you can reach higher you should probably think about upgrading the roof. Gather some wooden components for a better roof.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianWoodenHouse2_Step06
data.value: Climb up your "scaffolding" again and build a wooden roof. Keep in mind that you can use the concept of temporary "scaffolding" to reach the top of any structure with a little thought and experimentation.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianExtraStorage
data.value:
Experience better organization of your items when using crates and ore stockpiles.
Ore stockpiles accept ore and small stones. Crates accept a large amount of a single type of item and show a count on the outside.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianExtraStorage
data.value:
Experience better organization of your items when using crates and ore stockpiles.
Ore stockpiles accept ore and small stones. Crates accept a large amount of a single type of item and show a count on the outside.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianExtraStorage
data.value: A document describing how to store non-stockpilable items more efficiently.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianExtraStorage_Step01
data.value: You'll want some Crates but first you'll need the resources to craft them.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianExtraStorage_Step02
data.value: Crates are a good way to organize a lot of items. They will only accept one type of item at a time but they will also show that item on the front of the crate. This makes it easy to keep track of what you have in storage.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianExtraStorage_Step03
data.value: You may also want a place to store your ores and small stones. Gather some additional resources to make a Small Stockpile for Ores.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianExtraStorage_Step04
data.value: Small Stockpiles for Ores hold a large amount of ores. They work like other stockpiles except that they accept all ore types and small stones.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianExtraStorage_Step04_Active
data.value: Craft or gather a Small Stockpile for Ores

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianFurniture2
data.value:
Advanced furniture making techniques for Dining Tables, Chests, and Wardrobes.
Change your appearance at the Wardrobe and store your knick-knacks.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2
data.value:
Advanced furniture making techniques for Dining Tables, Chests, and Wardrobes.
Change your appearance at the Wardrobe and store your knick-knacks.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianFurniture2
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making additional furniture including a Wardrobe to change your appearance.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2_Step01
data.value: Start by gathering resources to craft a large chest. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2_Step02
data.value: Large chest are great additions to your furniture because they can hold quite a few items of multiple types at the same time. This gives you a place to store all of your odds & ends.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2_Step02_Active
data.value: Craft or gather a Large Chest

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2_Step03
data.value: Next you'll want to craft a Wardrobe. Gather the needed resources.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2_Step04
data.value: You never know when you'll want to change your outfit or give yourself a complete makeover. Having a wardrobe around means you can change your appearance whenever you want to.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianFurniture2_Step05
data.value: Give the wardrobe a try. Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" while the wardrobe is highlighted. Try changing the color of your clothes.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianStoneWalls
data.value:
A collection of building techniques to make walls out of stone.
Enjoy the security and aesthetics of the most advanced walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls
data.value:
A collection of building techniques to make walls out of stone.
Enjoy the security and aesthetics of the most advanced walls.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianStoneWalls
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building walls out of stone.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step01
data.value: You'll want to get started with some stone walls, windows and doors. Gather the components to construct them. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step02
data.value: Start building your stone house by constructing some walls. Place one with a window as well.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step03
data.value: The Wall With Door is a variant of the Wall With Entrance. Build a Wall With Door and try configuring it. Press "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to open or close the door. Hold "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to share access with other players.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step03_Short
data.value: Build a Wall With Door, a variant of Walls With Doorways, and try configuring it. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information about configuring doors.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step04
data.value: You can try constructing some Square Pillars and Wall Arches next. Gather the components that are needed.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step04_Unlock
data.value: Square Pillars and Wall Arches Unlocked!

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneWalls_Step05
data.value: Place two Wall Arches to make a large archway. You can use Square Pillars to decorate corner, fill in gaps or even used them under your Wall Arches to make them higher. Try placing a couple of them.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianTileRoofs
data.value:
How to build tile roofs.
Tile roofs are the most advanced roofs and they're exactly what you need atop your stone structures.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs
data.value:
How to build tile roofs.
Tile roofs are the most advanced roofs and they're exactly what you need atop your stone structures.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianTileRoofs
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making tile roofs.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs_Step01
data.value: To build half-timbered walls you need clay as filling. Clay could be found in most of regions not deep underground as soil layer, exceptions are snowy and desert regions.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs_Step02
data.value: Now build a few half-timbered walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs_Step03
data.value: You're going to need a kiln to build tile roofs. Gather components to build a kiln. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs_Step04
data.value: The first part of building a tile roof is firing the tiles in a kiln. Construct a kiln so you can start making tiles.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs_Step05
data.value: Use your kiln to craft some Roof Tiles. You'll need those along with some scrap wood to construct your tile roofs.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianTileRoofs_Step06
data.value: Hopefully you know how to use "scaffolding". If not, see the document on creating a better house. Make your way to the top of a building and build some tile roofs.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianSteelTools
data.value:
Advanced skills to create steel tools.
Steel tools are the most advanced tools with maximum durability and efficiency.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSteelTools
data.value:
Advanced skills to create steel tools.
Steel tools are the most advanced tools with maximum durability and efficiency.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianSteelTools
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making the most advanced tools out of steel.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSteelTools_Step01
data.value: Gather the resources you'll need to make a steel tool.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSteelTools_Step02
data.value: Charcoal is produced by slowly heating logs in a furnace. Craft some charcoal. Then combine the charcoal with iron ingots to craft steel ingots.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSteelTools_Step03
data.value: You need a better smithy to craft items from steel.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianSteelTools_Step04
data.value: Use the forge to craft your first master's tool, a Steel Hammer.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianStoneGate
data.value:
A collection of tricks and tips to build large Gates.
Gates are more than twice as wide as a normal entrance making them perfect for barns and keeps.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneGate
data.value:
A collection of tricks and tips to build large Gates.
Gates are more than twice as wide as a normal entrance making them perfect for barns and keeps.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianStoneGate
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building large Gates.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneGate_Step01
data.value: A Gate is a large structure that requires a lot of components.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneGate_Step02
data.value: Gates are wide enough to let carts go through so you will need a space that is at least two blocks wide to build them.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianStoneGate_Step03
data.value: In some cases smooth stone ramps could be required.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicAdvancedMechanics
data.value:
Includes knowledge about utilizing mechanical power to drastically increase milling speed and efficiency.
How to use a windmill to bring some life to your mill stone and increase output!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics
data.value:
Includes knowledge about utilizing mechanical power to drastically increase milling speed and efficiency.
How to use a windmill to bring some life to your mill stone and increase output!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step01
data.value: Advanced technology requires more effort to learn. Gather the resources you'll need first. Linseed Oil is required for mechanical parts to operate but, once it's expended, you will not get it back after de-constructing a mechanical block.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step02
data.value: A simple windmill is a perfect demonstration for mechanical blocks. Create a building at least five blocks tall. On a flat outside wall build a Mechanical Gristmill.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step03
data.value: Build 3 Framed Vertical Mechanical Shafts on top of the gristmill.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step04
data.value: On top of the shafts, place a Framed Vertical Mechanical Joint, Down. Make sure the horizontal connector faces away from the building.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step05
data.value: Attach a Mechanical Windmill to the joint. Use "[KEY:MoveFurther]" and "[KEY:MoveCloser]" while placing the Mechanical Windmill to change the distance.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step06
data.value: Notice that after attaching the windmill, your mechanical system came alive. if you connected everything properly, the round shafts in all of the mechanical blocks are moving now. However, it does nothing useful. Let's change that by crafting a Coarse Millstone Toolhead for Gristmill on Crafting Table.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step07
data.value: Each mechanical block added to the system increases friction. If you build a mechanical system that stops, then it has become too large for a single windmill to power. Reduce the amount of transmissions until windmill rotates. Place the toolhead into the mill's toolhead inventory. Add Wheat Straws to the Gristmill's crafting inventory and watch as they are crafted automatically into Flour Sacks.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step07_Short
data.value:
Each mechanical block added to the system increases friction and may make the system stop completely. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information about friction.
Place the toolhead into the mill's toolhead inventory. Add Wheat Straws to the Gristmill's crafting inventory and watch as they are crafted automatically into Flour Sacks.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanics_Step07_Active
data.value: Produce 2 Flour Sacks and take them.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicAdvancedMechanics
data.value: A book titled: "Engineer's Reference Book for Automated Crafting Systems - including bonus Gristmill Tutorial!"

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill
data.value:
Includes knowledge about utilizing mechanical power to drastically increase sawing and grinding efficiency.
Quickly saw Logs or grind flour and oil using the power of a Windmill to increase output!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill
data.value:
Includes knowledge about utilizing mechanical power to drastically increase sawing and grinding efficiency.
Quickly saw Logs or grind flour and oil using the power of a Windmill to increase output!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step01
data.value: Advanced technology requires more effort to learn. Gather the resources you'll need first. Linseed Oil is required for mechanical parts to operate but, once it's expended, you will not get it back after de-constructing a mechanical block.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step02
data.value: A simple windmill is a perfect demonstration for mechanical blocks. Create a building at least five blocks tall. On a flat outside wall build a Mechanical Sawmill.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step03
data.value: Build a Framed Vertical Mechanical Joint, Up next of the sawmill.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step04
data.value: Build 3 Framed Vertical Mechanical Shafts on top of the Framed Vertical Mechanical Joint.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step05
data.value: On top of the shafts, place a Framed Vertical Mechanical Joint, Down. Make sure the horizontal connector faces away from the building.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step06
data.value: Attach a Mechanical Windmill to the joint. Use "[KEY:MoveFurther]" and "[KEY:MoveCloser]" while placing the Mechanical Windmill to change the distance.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step07
data.value: Notice that after attaching the windmill, your mechanical system came alive. if you connected everything properly, the round shafts in all of the mechanical blocks are moving now. However, it does nothing useful. Let's change that by crafting a toolhead at a Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step07_Active
data.value: Craft a Timber Toolhead for Sawmill.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step08
data.value: Each mechanical block added to the system increases friction. If you build a mechanical system that stops, then it has become too large for a single windmill to power. Reduce the amount of transmissions until windmill rotates. Place the toolhead into the mill's toolhead inventory. Add Logs to Sawmill's inventory and watch as they are crafted automatically into Timbers.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill_Step08_Short
data.value:
Each mechanical block added to the system increases friction and may make the system stop completely. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information about friction.
Place the toolhead into the mill's toolhead inventory. Add Logs to Sawmill's inventory and watch as they are crafted automatically into Timbers.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicAdvancedMechanicsSawmill
data.value: A book titled: "Windmills and Other Mechanical Systems Made Easy! Free Guide to Sawmills included."

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicFineCeramics
data.value:
Basic techniques of working with clay using a kiln.
Make Clay Jars to fill with Linseed Oil or beverages.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicFineCeramics
data.value:
Basic techniques of working with clay using a kiln.
Make Clay Jars to fill with Linseed Oil or beverages.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicFineCeramics
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making basic items out of clay using a kiln.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicFineCeramics_Step00
data.value: If you are going to research terracotta you'll want to get started by digging up some clay. It is easily found under the topsoil in forested areas. So grab your shovel and get started. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicFineCeramics_Step01
data.value: You can't make terracotta without a kiln to bake the clay. Search for a kiln in the general search ("[KEY:SearchScreen]") and get to work constructing it.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicFineCeramics_Step02
data.value: One of the most common items produced is clay jars. They may seem simple but everyone needs a few clay jars so you'll be doing a brisk trade in no time!

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicSmelting
data.value:
Various methods detailing how to smelt various ores into metals.
Work with Copper, Iron, and Bronze to make tools, weapons, and items with metal parts.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting
data.value:
Various methods detailing how to smelt various ores into metals.
Work with Copper, Iron, and Bronze to make tools, weapons, and items with metal parts.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicSmelting
data.value: A document describing all of the details of smelting ores into ingots to make tools, weapons, and metal parts.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step00
data.value: Learning how to smelt metals will help you make tools and metal parts. You'll want to dig for some ore to get started so gather resources to make a shovel.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step01
data.value: Craft a wooden shovel. You'll need it to gather ore. Wooden shovels can be crafted in your inventory or at a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step02
data.value: You need some clay and small stones to craft a furnace. Clay can be found underground almost everywhere, especially where grass is.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step03
data.value: You need a furnace to smelt the ore. You can craft a furnace using a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step04
data.value: You are prepared for smelting but you don't have any ore. Go to a nearby deposit.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step05
data.value: There is ore in the ground here. Hopefully you still have your shovel with you because it's time to start digging!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSmelting_Step06
data.value: So now you have some metal ore. Good job! Use the furnace to craft your first ingot. Furnaces operate like crafting tables except they require fuel and the fire can be lit and doused. Many different items can be burnt for fuel.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicMetalTools
data.value:
Notes about making additional tools using various metals.
Smith mining and farming tools.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools
data.value:
Notes about making additional tools using various metals.
Smith mining and farming tools.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicMetalTools
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making metal tools for mining and farming.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools_Step00
data.value: Metal tools are crafted on a smithy or forge. Gather resources to craft a smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools_Step00_Active
data.value: • Gather 8x Copper Ingots or Iron Ingots

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools_Step01
data.value: Metal tools have to be hammered on an anvil at a smithy or forge. If you don't have one of these then you will have to craft a Smithy at a Crafting Table.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools_Step02
data.value: A common item created at a smithy is metal parts. These are used as components in torch stands, doors and more complex blocks. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools_Step03
data.value: Metal tools are more efficient and durable than wooden ones.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMetalTools_Step03_Active
data.value: Craft one Pickaxe, Hand Plow or Shovel

data.name: Description_Item_OreCopper
data.value: A soft metal that can be smelted into ingots using a furnace. Copper can be used on its own to make weak tools and weapons but it can be combined with tin to form a more useful alloy - bronze.

data.name: Description_Item_OreTin
data.value: A soft metal that can be smelted into ingots using a furnace. Tin is not very useful on its own but it can be combined with copper to form a more useful alloy - bronze.

data.name: Description_Item_OreSilver
data.value: A valuable metal that can be smelted into ingots using a furnace.

data.name: Description_Item_OreGold
data.value: A valuable metal that can be smelted into ingots using a furnace.

data.name: Description_Item_Sand
data.value:
Sand is a granular material composed of rock and meneral particles. It exists in mass quanities in the dessert as a kind of dirt or stone.
A use for sand is still being devised by master engineers in the Guild of Marek.

data.name: Description_Item_IngotSilver
data.value: Silver Ingots are created by smelting Silver Ore in the Furnace. Their engineering usage is not yet clear but they are valuable items.

data.name: Description_Item_IngotBronze
data.value: Bronze Ingots are created by melting Copper Ingots and Tin Ingots in the Furnace. They are used to craft moderately hard metal items in the Smithy or Forge.

data.name: Description_Item_IngotCopper
data.value: Copper Ingots are created by smelting Copper Ore in the Furnace. They are used to craft soft metal items in the Smithy or Forge.

data.name: Description_Item_IngotTin
data.value: Tin Ingots are created by smelting Tin Ore in the Furnace. Tin is too soft to craft items with but it can be mixed with copper to create bronze.

data.name: Description_Item_IngotGold
data.value: Gold Ingots are created by smelting Gold Ore in the Furnace. Their engineering usage is not yet clear but they are valuable items.

data.name: Description_Item_IngotSteel
data.value: Steel Ingots are created by melting Iron Ingots and Charcoal in the Furnace. They are used to craft very hard metal items in the Forge.

data.name: Description_Item_Charcoal
data.value: Charcoal is produced by slowly heating logs in the furnace. This process is known as pyrolysis and it concentrates the carbon content of the wood. Charcoal can be used as a long burning fuel or as a source of carbon when casting steel ingots.

data.name: Description_Item_Ink
data.value: Ink is a dark permanent substance that can be used to draft schematics onto blank scrolls.

data.name: Description_Item_StripsLeather
data.value: Strips of fine leather suitable for weapon grips.

data.name: Description_Item_Cloth
data.value: Cloth is crafted from linen string at a spinning wheel. It can be used for making flags, banners and other cloth items.

data.name: Description_ItemTag_Map
data.value: Map pieces can be combined to craft maps. Maps can be equipped to find treasures!

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicMechanics
data.value:
Mechanical skills to create anything from cranes to rope driven farm tools.
Build mechanized farm equipment and use rope drums and eye plates to connect things with ropes.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMechanics
data.value:
Mechanical skills to create anything from cranes to rope driven farm tools.
Build mechanized farm equipment and use rope drums and eye plates to connect things with ropes.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicMechanics
data.value: A document describing all of the details needed to engineer amazing creations.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMechanics_Step00
data.value: Sometimes you want to build something that moves using rope. Gather these resources and learn how to do it.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMechanics_Step01
data.value: Craft the following at a Crafting Table and Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMechanics_Step02
data.value:
Place a Catch Block where you want your rope to start. You will need to place it so you have room to attach a Rope Drum to it. Next, attach a Rope Drum to the Catch Block. Finally, attach a Hand Crank Wheel to the other end of the Rope Drum. Attach the Rope Eye Plate to the object you want to pull. Use Basic Rope to connect the eye plate to the rope drum.
That's it. Use "[KEY:CharacterUse]" or "Shift+[KEY:CharacterUse]" to pull the rope in and out of the Rope Drum.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMechanics_Step02_Short
data.value: Place a Catch Block where you want your rope to start. You will need to place it so you have room to attach a Rope Drum to it. Next, attach a Rope Drum to the Catch Block. Finally, attach a Hand Crank Wheel to the other end of the Rope Drum. Attach the Rope Eye Plate to the object you want to pull. Use Basic Rope to connect the eye plate to the rope drum. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for information about using the Hand Crank Wheel.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicWeaving
data.value:
Various skills to weave items from flax.
Create linen string that can be woven into ropes or cloth. Create banners and flags.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving
data.value:
Various skills to weave items from flax.
Create linen string that can be woven into ropes or cloth. Create banners and flags.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicWeaving
data.value: A document describing all of the details of weaving cloth for banners and crafting ropes.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step00
data.value: Gather some resources to prepare for weaving.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step01
data.value: Learning weaving will allow you to craft cloth which has multiple uses. Before you can start weaving you have craft a Spinning Wheel and use it to make Linen String.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step02
data.value: Linen string is made from Flax Straws and is used to craft rope and cloth. You'll notice during this process that it takes a lot of flax to make string.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step03
data.value: It's time to weave the string into Cloth.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step04
data.value: Great! Now you can make things using the Cloth. For this example, start by crafting a Personal Flag.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step05
data.value: That's a nice flag you have! Let's try something different with it. Pick up your first flag by holding "[KEY:CharacterUse]".

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step06
data.value: Place the flag again, but this time use its Personal Banner variants. You can use any size you want.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step07
data.value: Those banners are pretty great but they lack a sense of personal style. Gather some more resources so you can build a Banner Workstation.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step08
data.value: Add the Banner Workstations to your toolbar from the Search Screen ("[KEY:SearchScreen]"). Build it where you have some room work.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step09
data.value: You can use the Banner Workstation to customize your personal flags and banners as well as house flags and banners. If you are not a member of a House there will be no house pattern in the Banner Workstation. You can join or create a House in the Houses Screen by pressing "[KEY:FactionsScreen]".

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWeaving_Step09_Short
data.value: You can use the Banner Workstation to customize your personal flag. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information about house flags and joining houses.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicWoodenHouse
data.value:
Basic construction techniques to build simple wooden buildings.
These techniques teach you how to build a foundation, floors, basic walls, and some simple roofing.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse
data.value:
Basic construction techniques to build simple wooden buildings.
These techniques teach you how to build a foundation, floors, basic walls, and some simple roofing.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicWoodenHouse
data.value: A document describing construction techniques to build simple wooden buildings.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step00
data.value: It takes a lot of wood to build a house. Start by gathering supplies.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step01
data.value: This is the moment you've been waiting for. It's time to begin construction of your house. Try to construct some wooden stairs where the entrance to your house will be. This will make it easer to get in and out during construction.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step02
data.value: Next you'll want to build some wooden supports. Gather supplies to get started on a few of them.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step03
data.value: If you keep walking on those supports you're going to twist your ankle. You can start constructing floors on top of the supports. To attach the the floors to the top of the supports you may need to turn off compound building mode. This prevents you from overlapping some blocks in the same space. Press "[KEY:SwitchCompoundBuilding]" to toggle compound building mode on/off or hold "[KEY:CompoundBuilding]" to disable it momentarily.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step03_Short
data.value: You can start constructing floors on top of the supports. NOTE: Turn off compound building mode. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for instructions.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step04
data.value: Equip the wall available in the general search ("[KEY:SearchScreen]"). Most walls only rotate around their vertical axis but a this one can be rotated on another axis. You'll want to place walls on top of the floors. This will require compound building mode be turned on so that the walls and floors can share the same space. Go ahead and try building a few. Make sure you don't block access to your stairs!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse_Step04_Short
data.value: Equip the wall available in the general search ("[KEY:SearchScreen]"). Turn on compound building mode to place walls on top of the floors. Press "[KEY:QuestLog]" for more information.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicAdvancedFood
data.value:
Recipes for more nutritious foods that will keep engineers full and happy!
Simple recipes that are filling and provide everything that engineers need to work hard.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedFood
data.value:
Recipes for more nutritious foods that will keep engineers full and happy!
Simple recipes that are filling and provide everything that engineers need to work hard.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicAdvancedFood
data.value: A document describing all of the kitchen secrets your grandma never told you about.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedFood_Step00
data.value: If you're going to do some serious cooking you're going to want an Oven. Gather the resources you will need to craft one.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedFood_Step01
data.value: Craft an oven and find a convenient location to place it. You can use the oven to cook healthy meals that will increase your well-being.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicAdvancedFood_Step02
data.value: Now that you have an Oven you can try baking some Bread! Eat one and enjoy the fruit of your labor!

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicIronCrossbow
data.value:
The details of crafting crossbows and deer hunting.
Crossbows can hit targets at a distance to send bandits running or to bring down animals that can be used for food and leather.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow
data.value:
The details of crafting crossbows and deer hunting.
Crossbows can hit targets at a distance to send bandits running or to bring down animals that can be used for food and leather.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicIronCrossbow
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making crossbows to shoot bandits and other animals.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step00
data.value: First thing you will need for hunting is a crossbow. Gather some resources to craft one.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step01
data.value: Wooden Crossbow is good enough for hunting. Try crafting one and then craft some Crossbow Bolts.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step02
data.value: Equip your new crossbow and wait for a bolt to load. Once it loads you are ready to hunt a deer.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step03
data.value: Now the hardest part: find deer and shoot it. "[KEY:ToolSecondary]" will zoom in to make it easier to aim. Deers are common tenants of forests, tundras and jungles.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step04
data.value: For working with leather you will need Tanning Rack. Acquire resources to build one.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step05
data.value: Now you're able to build a Tanning Rack.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicIronCrossbow_Step06
data.value: Put Deer Pelt into Tanning Rack and make a Tanned Leather.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryAdvWeapons
data.value: Knowledge about iron crossbow, hunting deer and working with leather.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons
data.value: Knowledge about iron crossbow, hunting deer and working with leather.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryAdvWeapons
data.value: A document describing all of the details about making iron crossbow and working with leather.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step01
data.value: You will need metal and leather to craft a sword. Gather some Iron Ingots for the sword. You will need a Deer Pelt for leather, so gather resources to make a crossbow for hunting.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step01_Active
data.value: • Smelt either 4x Iron Ingots or 4x Bronze Ingots

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step02
data.value: A Wooden Crossbow is good enough for hunting. Craft a crossbow and bolts or equip one if you have it.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step03
data.value: Now the hardest part: find a deer and shoot it. "[KEY:ToolSecondary]" will zoom in to make it easier to aim. Deer are common tenants of forests, tundras and tropical forests.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step04
data.value: For working with leather you will need a Tanning Rack. Acquire resources to build one.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step05
data.value: Now you're able to build a Tanning Rack.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step06
data.value: Put a Deer Pelt into the Tanning Rack's inventory and make a Tanned Leather.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step07
data.value: Leather Strips can be crafted in your inventory.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step08
data.value: Use a Forge to craft an Iron or Bronze Sword.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvWeapons_Step08_Active
data.value: Craft 1x Iron Sword or Bronze Sword

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicSeeding
data.value:
Knowledge about tilling soil, growing crops. and preparing seeds.
Plant your fence in your farm, plant your first crops, and carve a Jack-o'-Lantern!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding
data.value:
Knowledge about tilling soil, growing crops. and preparing seeds.
Plant your fence in your farm, plant your first crops, and carve a Jack-o'-Lantern!

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicSeeding
data.value: A document describing all of the details of tilling soil, preparing seeds for planting, and growing crops on your farm.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step00
data.value: Before you can start growing crops you'll need some seeds. Search for wild plants.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step00_Active
data.value: Gather 2 Flax, Wheat, Pumpkins, Cabbages or Herbs

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step01
data.value: Craft seedbags from the plants you have gathered.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step02
data.value: Use a Hand Plow to prepare an area of soil for planting. If you don't have a hand plow one can be crafted in a smithy or forge.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step03
data.value: Deer like to eat the plants in your garden. Use Stick Fences to keep the deer out.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step04
data.value: Equip the seedbag you crafted and use it to plant seeds in the prepared soil. After the crops finish growing, which will take a long time, harvest them. Congratulations, you are now a farm engineer!

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSeeding_Step04_Active
data.value: Harvest Flax, Wheat, Pumpkins, Cabbages or Herbs

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicSimpleCart
data.value:
The basic techniques for building basic carts.
Learn how to make the mechanical parts to get your goods rolling to the market.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart
data.value:
The basic techniques for building basic carts.
Learn how to make the mechanical parts to get your goods rolling to the market.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicSimpleCart
data.value: A document describing all of the details of mechanical parts for building basic carts.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart_Step01
data.value: Sometimes you need some storage while you're on the go. Here are the components you'll need to build a simple supply cart.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart_Step02
data.value: Place a Timber vertically into ground to hold up the cart while you work on it. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for an example.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart_Step03
data.value: Place one stockpile on top of the Timber. Place the second stockpile on the end of the first. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for an example.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart_Step04
data.value:
Place One-Sided Catch Blocks or other catchblocks on the front and back corners to attach the wheels. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for an example.
*Note: One-Sided Catch Blocks are a variant of regular Catch Blocks.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart_Step05
data.value:
Add a wheel to the outside of each catch block. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for an example.
You can push the cart to move it or you can pull it with your rope tool. To use your rope tool, empty your hands by pressing "[KEY:ToolbarItemDeselect]". Then aim at the cart and use the "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" to attach the rope. When you pull the rope it will turn from green to yellow and finally red. If you continue pulling harder the rope will break free. If you are careful about how you use the rope, it can pull very heavy objects.
Remove the vertical timber holding the cart in place to drop it to the ground.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSimpleCart_Step05_Short
data.value: Add a wheel to the outside of each catch block. You can push the cart to move it or you can pull it with your rope tool. See the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for an example image or for more information on the rope tool.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicWoodenHouse2
data.value:
Use Plank Walls and Wooden Roofs to make a better building.
Small Stairs and Wall-Walks can be used as improvised scaffolding to climb to the top of any structure and place better roofing.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2
data.value:
Use Plank Walls and Wooden Roofs to make a better building.
Small Stairs and Wall-Walks can be used as improvised scaffolding to climb to the top of any structure and place better roofing.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicWoodenHouse2
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building improved wooden houses with sturdy wooden roofs.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2_Step01
data.value: Start by gathering some components to build Plank Walls and "scaffolding".

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2_Step02
data.value: Plank Walls higher quality than Log Walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2_Step03
data.value: Building Higher can seem challenging but placing some Small Stairs and Wall-Walks as a form of "scaffolding" makes it easy. Start with some Small Stairs on an outside wall and don't forget to leave room near the top of the stairs for the Wall-Walk.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2_Step04
data.value: Climb the Small Stairs and build a Wall-Walk to stand on.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2_Step05
data.value: Now that you can reach higher you should probably think about upgrading the roof. Gather some wooden components for a better roof.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWoodenHouse2_Step06
data.value: Climb up your "scaffolding" again and build a wooden roof. Keep in mind that you can use the concept of temporary "scaffolding" to reach the top of any structure with a little thought and experimentation.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicWriting
data.value: The skills of making the tools to record knowledge for those that come after.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicWriting
data.value: The skills of making the tools to record knowledge for those that come after.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicWriting
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making the tools to record knowledge.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicLeatherworking
data.value: Leatherworking is the art of working with leather.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicLeatherworking
data.value: Leatherworking is the art of working with leather.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicLeatherworking
data.value: A document describing all of the details of leatherworking.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicMilling
data.value:
The core techniques behind milling grains and seeds.
Mill seeds to make oil and grains to make flour.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMilling
data.value:
The core techniques behind milling grains and seeds.
Mill seeds to make oil and grains to make flour.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicMilling
data.value: A document describing all of the details of milling grains and seeds.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMilling_Step00
data.value: You will need to make a Mill Stone to learn how to mill grains.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMilling_Step01
data.value: You can mill grains on a Mill Stone to produce flour. Go to a crafting table with the resources you gathered to get started crafting a Mill Stone.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMilling_Step02
data.value: Now you need something to mill. Look around in grassy fields for some Wheat Straws.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicMilling_Step03
data.value: Put the Wheat Straws in the Mill Stone and craft a Flour Sack.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_EconomicSchematicsDrawing
data.value:
The skill of drafting schematics to share knowledge with other engineers.
Make schematics using ink on scrolls to share knowledge with your friends.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing
data.value:
The skill of drafting schematics to share knowledge with other engineers.
Make schematics using ink on scrolls to share knowledge with your friends.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing_Step00
data.value: Get started by gathering the resources needed to make a schematic.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing_Step01
data.value: Schematics are drafted on Blank Scrolls. You'll need the Drafting Table to craft Blank Scrolls.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing_Step02
data.value: Making Blank Scrolls requires either Tanned Leather to make vellum or scrapwood to make paper. Put Tanned Leather or enough scrapwood into the Drafting Table to craft Blank Scrolls out of it.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing_Step04
data.value: Ink is made with Charcoal, which can be crafted in the furnace.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing_Step05
data.value: Use the Charcoal to craft Ink at the Drafting Table.

data.name: Description_Quest_EconomicSchematicsDrawing_Step06
data.value: Now you have everything you need to craft a Schematic. Use a Drafting Table to create your first Schematic.

data.name: Description_Schematic_EconomicSchematicsDrawing
data.value:
A document describing how to make more documents.
"I'll write it down so you don't forget it." ~A Wise Engineer

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryCombatBasics
data.value: Craft your first weapon and learn basic combat.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics
data.value: Craft your first weapon and learn basic combat.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryCombatBasics
data.value: A document describing combat with a basic weapon.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step01
data.value: First you'll need a weapon. Clubs are crude but effective.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step03
data.value: Now you need a target to practice. Gather materials to craft a Training Dummy.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step04
data.value: Training Dummies can be crafting at a Crafting Table.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step05
data.value: Put the Training Dummy in the ground and equip a weapon for training.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step06
data.value: You can attack your target from three directions.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step07
data.value: Right and left strikes are common. You will usually chain them together to avoid getting blocked.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step08
data.value:
Downward attacks are slower, but have higher chances of inflicting bleeding or a stunning blow.
Charged attacks have even higher chances of stunning your opponent or inflicting a bleeding wound.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step09
data.value:
Defense is a very important part of combat. With a weapon, you can only block in one direction.
In combat, you must watch to see where your opponent will strike so you can block in the appropriate direction.
Practice blocking from all three directions.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step09_Active
data.value: Hold block ("[KEY:SecondaryClick]") and aim at all three directions.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryCombatBasics_Step09_Complete
data.value: Performed block in all three directions.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitarySmelting
data.value:
Various methods detailing how to smelt various ores into metals.
Work with Copper, Iron, and Bronze to make tools, weapons, and items with metal parts.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting
data.value:
Various methods detailing how to smelt various ores into metals.
Work with Copper, Iron, and Bronze to make tools, weapons, and items with metal parts.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitarySmelting
data.value: A document describing all of the details of smelting ores into ingots to make tools, weapons, and metal parts.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step00
data.value: It looks like you want to learn about military engineering. You'll learn about building strong defenses, strong weapons, and siegecraft. Some of what you learn will include other types of engineering but only engineers who have researched military techniques can build the strongest. Learning how to smelt metals will help you make tools and metal parts. You'll want to dig for some ore to get started so gather resources to make a shovel.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step01
data.value: Craft a wooden shovel. You'll need it to gather ore. Wooden shovels can be crafted in your inventory or at a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step02
data.value: You need some clay and small stones to craft a furnace. Clay can be found underground almost everywhere, especially where grass is.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step03
data.value: You need a furnace to smelt the ore. You can craft a furnace using a crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step04
data.value: You are prepared for smelting but you don't have any ore. Go to a nearby deposit.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step05
data.value: There is ore in the ground here. Hopefully you still have your shovel with you because it's time to start digging!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySmelting_Step06
data.value: So now you have some metal ore. Good job! Use the furnace to craft your first ingot. Furnaces operate like crafting tables except they require fuel and the fire can be lit and doused. Many different items can be burnt for fuel.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryStoneGates
data.value:
A set of heavy gates that can be built into stone walls.
Designs for a draw bridge and a portcullis that allow you to pass through your castle walls to chase down hapless barbarians!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneGates
data.value:
A set of heavy gates that can be built into stone walls.
Designs for a draw bridge and a portcullis that allow you to pass through your castle walls to chase down hapless barbarians!

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryStoneGates
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building sturdy passages in stone walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneGates_Step01
data.value: You might want something a little bigger than a door to get in and out of your defenses. That is where defensive barriers are useful. Gather resources to start building a Portcullis or Drawbridge.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryPalisades
data.value:
Basic palisade building techniques to help fortify encampments.
Build fortifications from palisades and wall-walks to defend your encampment.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisades
data.value:
Basic palisade building techniques to help fortify encampments.
Build fortifications from palisades and wall-walks to defend your encampment.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryPalisades
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building palisades.

data.name: Description_Quest_Palisades_Step01
data.value: It looks like you want to learn about military engineering. You'll learn about building strong defenses, strong weapons, and siegecraft. Some of what you learn will include other types of engineering but only engineers who have researched military techniques can build the strongest. Learning how to build palisades will help you to protect your home! Start by making sure you have the resources first.

data.name: Description_Quest_Palisades_Step02
data.value: You'll want to get started building some defenses for your camp. Start with some palisades to form the base of a wall.

data.name: Description_Quest_Palisades_Step03
data.value: Build Palisade Spikes or Palisade Battlements on top of the Palisades.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryStoneWallsRound
data.value:
Tricks of the stonecutter trade detailing how to make round walls using stone.
Round walls, doors, and windows for building round towers on the round world.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWallsRound
data.value:
Tricks of the stonecutter trade detailing how to make round walls using stone.
Round walls, doors, and windows for building round towers on the round world.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryStoneWallsRound
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building round walls, doors, and windows using stone.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWallsRound_Step01
data.value: Maybe sharp corners are harder to guard or you are just trying to follow some natural terrain. Whatever the reason, if you may want to build some round stone walls, this quest is for you.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWallsRound_Step02
data.value: Round walls can be quite large which makes them a little more difficult to place. Use "[KEY:MoveFurther]" so you can see the entire wall. Notice which part of the wall follows your aiming dot. Keeping this in mind will make aligning it easier. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryMetalPickaxe
data.value:
Techniques for forging metal tools.
Smith pickaxes and hammers to aid in mining and construction of fortifications.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalPickaxe
data.value:
Techniques for forging metal tools.
Smith pickaxes and hammers to aid in mining and construction of fortifications.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryMetalPickaxe
data.value: A document describing all of the details of forging metal tools for mining and construction.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalPickaxe_Step01
data.value: If you're going to build strong defenses you're going to want some strong tools to do it with. Gather resources to research smithing.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalPickaxe_Step02
data.value: Metal tools can be made by smithing. Since that requires an anvil you'll need to craft a Smithy to get started.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalPickaxe_Step03
data.value: Gather the resources needed to make a tool. Smelt ore into ingots at the furnace as needed.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalPickaxe_Step01_Active
data.value: • Craft 2x Copper Ingots or Iron Ingots

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalPickaxe_Step03
data.value: Add the resources to a smithy's inventory and craft a metal tool.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryMetalWeapons
data.value:
Smithing skills for making weapons out of metals.
Forge metal studded clubs and axes. The latter can be used to attack trees, allowing you to take their resources.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalWeapons
data.value:
Smithing skills for making weapons out of metals.
Forge metal studded clubs and axes. The latter can be used to attack trees, allowing you to take their resources.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryMetalWeapons
data.value: A document describing all of the details of crafting weapons from metals.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalWeapons_Step01
data.value: Nothing says military like a nice metal weapon. Gather resources to research smithing.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalWeapons_Step02
data.value: Weapons can be made by smithing. Since that requires an anvil you'll need to craft a Smithy to get started.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalWeapons_Step03
data.value: Gather the resources you need to craft a Studded Club.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalWeapons_Step03_Active
data.value: • Gather 2x Copper Ingots or Iron Ingots

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMetalWeapons_Step04
data.value: Add the resources to a smithy's inventory and craft a metal tool.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitarySteelCrossbow
data.value: The details of working steel to make crossbows.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelCrossbow
data.value: The details of working steel to make crossbows.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitarySteelCrossbow
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making steel crossbows.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelCrossbow_Step01
data.value: If you want more durability and faster reloading, you want a Steel Crossbow!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelCrossbow_Step02
data.value: Use a Forge to craft a Steel Crossbow.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryPalisadesGate
data.value:
A collection of tricks and techniques to build sturdy palisade gates.
You may need a way out of your defensive parimeter so you can attack the enemy as they flee your strongly defended walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisadesGate
data.value:
A collection of tricks and techniques to build sturdy palisade gates.
You may need a way out of your defensive parimeter so you can attack the enemy as they flee your strongly defended walls.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisadesGate_Step01
data.value: Gates are, as you might expect, a little more complicated than walls. They require more parts, including some metal for hinges. Here's a list of components that you'll need to gather to build a palisade gate. You can craft Metal Parts in a Furnace or Smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisadesGate_Step02
data.value: You're going to want to pick a spot to build this palisade gate. They're commonly found in palisade walls but some people find other uses for them. Look carefully at how you have it rotated before you place it. The doors only swing in one direction.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryPalisadesGate
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building sturdy palisade gates.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryProjectiles
data.value:
Stonecutting techniques to carve perfect projectiles.
Sure, you could launch a pumpkin at the enemy but stone projectiles hurt more!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryProjectiles
data.value:
Stonecutting techniques to carve perfect projectiles.
Sure, you could launch a pumpkin at the enemy but stone projectiles hurt more!

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryProjectiles
data.value: A document describing all of the details of carving perfect stone projectiles.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryProjectiles_Step01
data.value: Stone can be carved into perfectly round projectiles. Gather stones to get started.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryProjectiles_Step02
data.value: Practice crafting some Small Projectiles at a Crafting Table.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryHardening
data.value: A document describing all of the details of hardening metal to make strong tools and weapons.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryHardening_Step01
data.value: Harder metals make weapons and tools with more durability. To learn the skills needed to work with these hard metals you'll need to build a smithy.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryHardening_Step02
data.value: A good smithy can be used to smith tools and weapons from hardened metals. Go ahead and craft one now. You'll be making the best items in no time!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryHardening_Step03
data.value: Gather copper and tin to make bronze.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryHardening_Step04
data.value: Craft a bronze ingot to make a sword.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryHardening_Step05
data.value: Use the smithy to craft a sword.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryStoneWalls
data.value:
A collection of building techniques for making various walls out of stone.
Frustrate the enemy with these stone walls, stone doors, stone windows, stone arrowslits, and other stone wall variations.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWalls
data.value:
A collection of building techniques for making various walls out of stone.
Frustrate the enemy with these stone walls, stone doors, stone windows, stone arrowslits, and other stone wall variations.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWallsRound_Step03
data.value: You'll probably want round floors in your structure to match your round walls. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWalls_Step01
data.value: At some point you get tired of patching up your palisades from barbarians hitting them or maybe you know an enemy is coming. Either way it's time fortify your position!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWalls_Step02
data.value: Stone walls are an easy way to build better fortifications. Build a couple of them to get started.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneWalls_Step03
data.value: By themselves they're just walls. Attach some battlements to the tops of the walls and you have fortifications you can fight from!

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryStoneWalls
data.value: A document describing all of the details of various stone walls.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryMechanics
data.value:
Basic mechanical elements to create cranes, pull carts, or the central elements of a catapult.
Use rope drums and eye plates to connect ropes to your siege equipment.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMechanics
data.value:
Basic mechanical elements to create cranes, pull carts, or the central elements of a catapult.
Use rope drums and eye plates to connect ropes to your siege equipment.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryMechanics
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building basic mechanical elements.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMechanics_Step01
data.value: Gather resources to craft some basic mechanical parts.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMechanics_Step03
data.value: Place the catch block and then attach the rope drum and hand crank wheel to it. Attach the rope eye plate to something you want to pull.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMechanics_Step04
data.value: Attach a rope to the rope drum and the rope eye plate. Remember that the rope drum will only shorten the rope from this point so make sure you have the two at their maximum distance before connecting the rope.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryMechanics_Step05
data.value: Attach a rope to the rope drum and the rope eye plate. Hold "[KEY:CharacterUse]" to turn the hand crank wheel to make the rope shorter or longer. Hold "Shift + [KEY:CharacterUse]" to change directions.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitarySteelTools
data.value:
Advanced toolmaking skills to create steel equipment.
Make the strongest swords, axes, and crossbows to beat your enemies with.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelTools
data.value:
Advanced toolmaking skills to create steel equipment.
Make the strongest swords, axes, and crossbows to beat your enemies with.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitarySteelTools
data.value: A document describing all of the details of making tools and weapons out of steel.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelTools_Step01
data.value: First step to make steel weapons is to obtain a Forge. Gather resources to craft one or interact with existing Forge to skip this step.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelTools_Step02
data.value: Steel Ingots are made from Iron Ingots and Charcoal in a Furnace. Start by making Charcoal from logs. Then use charcoal and iron to make Steel Ingots.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelTools_Step03
data.value: Forging steel weapons requires a better workstation than a Smithy. Craft a Forge to make your steel weapon.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySteelTools_Step04
data.value: You have everything you need to craft a Steel Sword, the mightiest of all blades!

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryStoneCubes
data.value:
Advanced stonecutting techniques to create solid defensive works.
These are the "Big Boy Blocks" for the best castle defenses!

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneCubes
data.value:
Advanced stonecutting techniques to create solid defensive works.
These are the "Big Boy Blocks" for the best castle defenses!

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryStoneCubes
data.value: A document describing all of the details of advanced stonecutting techniques to create solid defensive works.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneCubes_Step01
data.value: The most defensible structures are built entirely from stone. You might be able to guess that this will take a lot of stone. Gather what you need to get started. You may have to build a stockpile if your personal inventory is not large enough.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneCubes_Step02
data.value: Start building your solid stone structure by placing a foundation of Stone Cubes. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneCubes_Step03
data.value: Adding some stairs will make it easier to enter and leave your new structure. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryStoneCubes_Step04
data.value: Start building your new stone house or castle by placing some of these blocks. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics
data.value:
A set of mechanisms used for building engines of war.
Catapult buckets and torsion springs make siege equipment even easier to produce.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics
data.value:
A set of mechanisms used for building engines of war.
Catapult buckets and torsion springs make siege equipment even easier to produce.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics
data.value: A document describing all of the details of putting the siege into your mechanics.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step01
data.value: Engines of war are some of the most complex constructions in Medieval Engineers. Let's start with the simplest of them, a catapult. You will need to build a cart chassis first. Gather the parts needed to build a chassis.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step02
data.value: Place a Timber vertically into ground to hold your chassis above the ground while you build. Then place a Timber horizontally on side of first timber. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step02b
data.value: Place a Timber 8 on each end of the horizontal timber 10 at 90 degree angles. Use 2 Timber 8 to extend the ones you just placed. Connect the ends of the new timbers together with another Timber 8 to make a large rectangle. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step03
data.value: Place Catch Blocks on each corner. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step04
data.value: Add a wheel to the outside of each catch block. Rotate the wheels so that the braces face toward the cart. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step05
data.value: Now that you have the chassis finished, gather the parts needed to build a throwing mechanism.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step06
data.value: Place 3 Timber 8 inside the chassis 3 space from one end to build a small platform. Place a Rope Torsion Spring on top of this platform. See the example images in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step07
data.value: Make sure the small timber protruding from the Rope Torsion Spring points at the closest end of the chassis. Attach a Timber 6 to the protruding timber. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step08
data.value: This will function as the throwing arm. You will need a way to pull the arm back. Place a Rope Eye Plate on top of the new timber at the end. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step09
data.value: Place a Catapult Bucket on the end of the throwing arm. Make sure the opening faces down. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step10
data.value: Now that the throwing mechanism is finished, gather the parts needed to build a loading mechanism.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step11
data.value: On the end of the chassis farthest from the throwing mechanism, place an Extended Catch Block and a One-Sided Catch block. These should go on top of the chassis 2 spaces from the end. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step12
data.value: Place a Lockable Rope Drum between the catch blocks. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step13
data.value: Place a Hand Crank Wheel on the outside of the Extended Catch Block. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryAdvancedMechanics_Step14
data.value: You will need to attach the Lockable Rope Drum to the Rope Eye Plate on the throwing arm using a Basic Rope. Lock the rope drum and turn the hand crank to pull back the arm. Place something in the bucket and unlock the rope drum to fire the catapult. You only need to invent some munitions and you're ready to siege castles! See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitarySimpleCart
data.value:
A set of drawings that shows how to assemble a basic supply cart.
You'll have no trouble moving additional supplies to your fortress with this regulation cargo cart design.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart
data.value:
A set of drawings that shows how to assemble a basic supply cart.
You'll have no trouble moving additional supplies to your fortress with this regulation cargo cart design.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitarySimpleCart
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building a basic supply cart.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step01
data.value: Sometimes you need some storage while you're on the go. Start by crafting the needed resources.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step02
data.value: Here are the blocks you'll need to build a simple supply cart.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step03_Short
data.value: Place a Timber vertically into ground to hold up the cart while you work on it. Then place another Timber horizontally on the side of the first timber to make a T shape. See the example image and placement hints in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step03
data.value:
Place a Timber vertically into ground to hold up the cart while you work on it. Then place another Timber horizontally on the side of the first timber to make a T shape.
You may need to adjust the placement distance of the timber to place it properly. Use "Ctrl + [KEY:ScrollAxis]" to adjust the maximum distance.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step04
data.value: Add two Timber 5s to the horizontal Timber. This should make a wide U shape. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step05
data.value: Add a Timber 8 to close the rectangle. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step06
data.value: The rectangular chassis is done but it still needs wheels. Place catch blocks on the front and back corners to attach the wheels. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step07
data.value: Add a wheel to the outside of each catch block. Rotate the wheels so that the braces face toward the cart. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step08
data.value: Now that the chassis is ready to roll you'll want to add some small chests for cargo.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step09
data.value:
Place the 4 chests inside the cart to finish it. See the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").
You can push the cart to move it or you can pull it with your rope tool. To use your rope tool, empty your hands by pressing "[KEY:ToolbarItemDeselect]". Then aim at the cart and use the "[KEY:SecondaryClick]" to attach the rope. When you pull the rope it will turn from green to yellow and finally red. If you continue pulling harder the rope will break free. If you are careful about how you use the rope, it can pull very heavy objects.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitarySimpleCart_Step09_Short
