data.value: Place the 4 chests inside the cart to finish it. See information about moving carts with the rope tool or view the example image in the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]").

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_MilitaryPalisadesRound
data.value:
Building techniques to make round palisade walls.
The ground doesn't go in straight lines so why should your defenses?

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisadesRound
data.value:
Building techniques to make round palisade walls.
The ground doesn't go in straight lines so why should your defenses?

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisadesRound_Step01
data.value: Maybe sharp corners are harder to guard or you are just trying to follow some natural terrain. Whatever the reason, if you may want to build some round palisades, this quest is for you.

data.name: Description_Quest_MilitaryPalisadesRound_Step02
data.value: Round palisades are quite large which makes them a little more difficult to place. Use "[KEY:MoveFurther]" so you can see the entire wall if needed. Notice which part of the wall follows your aiming dot. Keeping this in mind will make it easier to align.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MilitaryPalisadesRound
data.value: A document describing all of the details of building round palisade walls.

data.name: Description_Weapon_CrossbowSteel
data.value: The most advanced crossbow, made out of hardened materials that is very reliable. Crossbows can be used to hunt deer and fight enemies at a distance. Zoom in for maximum accuracy.

data.name: Description_BannerLayer_Pattern
data.value: Pattern to be displayed on this banner layer.

data.name: Description_BannerLayer_Symbol
data.value: Symbol to be displayed on this banner layer.

data.name: Description_Block_SawmillMechanical
data.value:
Provided with a connection to mechanical power and an appropriate toolhead, the mechanical sawmill will cut wood into timbers or planks. This process is both faster and more efficient than other methods.
Insert a sawmill toolhead to craft.

data.name: Description_Item_SawbladesTimber
data.value:
Used to craft timbers out of logs. Insert into the 'Toolhead' slot of a Mechanical Sawmill.
Input: Logs Output: Timbers

data.name: Description_Item_SawbladesPlank
data.value:
Used to craft planks out of timbers or logs. Insert into the 'Toolhead' slot of a Mechanical Sawmill.
Input: Logs and Timbers Output: Planks

data.name: Description_Block_StampMillMechanical
data.value:
Provided with a connection to mechanical power and an appropriate toolhead, the mechanical stamp mill will smash ore and stone, producing ore dust or small stones, respectively. This process is both faster and more efficient than other methods.
Insert a Stamp Mill toolhead to craft.

data.name: Description_Item_HammerOre
data.value:
Used to craft ore dust out of ore pieces. Insert into the 'Toolhead' slot of a Mechanical Stamp Mill.
Input: Ore Output: Dust

data.name: Description_Item_HammerStone
data.value:
Used to craft small stones out of large stones. Insert into the 'Toolhead' slot of a Mechanical Stamp Mill.
Input: Large Stones Output: Small Stones

data.name: Description_Control_ToggleTracking
data.value: Toggles tracking of targets while in spectator mode.

data.value: Press {0} to gather from the bush.

data.value: Debug tool for chipping of fracture pieces from a block. Could be used for level design and creating ruins.

data.name: Description_Schematic_UniqueStatueKing
data.value: Notes of sculptor about his experience of creating a statue for the King. Found in a treasure.

data.name: DisplayName_Schematic_UniqueWallStoneWindowDouble
data.value: Unique Schematic: Wall With Double Windows

data.name: Description_Schematic_UniqueWallStoneWindowDouble
data.value: Architect's draft with uncommon window decoration. Found in a treasure.

data.name: Description_Schematic_MasterScroll
data.value: Scroll of ultimate knowledge. Unlocks everything.

data.name: Description_Stat_Health
data.value: The amount of health you have. When this value hits 0 you will die.

data.name: Description_Stat_Stamina
data.value: The amount of stamina you have. Stamina is used for various activities such as sprinting, combat, building, etc.

data.name: Description_Stat_Food
data.value: The amount of food you have. Health and stamina regeneration consume food, when food hits 0 these regenerate more slowly.

data.name: Description_Stat_Vigor
data.value: Your overall well-being. Vigor affects health and stamina regeneration rates, your maximum hitpoints, your maximum stamina, and how fast you can perform actions.

data.name: Description_Stat_BuildMultiplier
data.value: The speed at which you can build.

data.name: Description_Stat_CuttingLoss
data.value: The speed at which you can cut trees.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Exhausted
data.value: You have overexerted yourself and need a moment to catch your breath.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Resting
data.value: While standing still you feel your stamina regenerating faster.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Starvation
data.value: You are starving! Your stamina and health regeneration are slow, your tools feel heavy, and you are losing vigor.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Cozy
data.value: You feel cozy. You are not as hungry as you normally would be.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Hungry
data.value: You feel like you should get something to eat.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_VigorGain
data.value: You feel invigorated after a good meal. You feel yourself slowly getting healthier and your tools don't feel as heavy as they did.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_VigorLoss
data.value: You are not feeling very well. You feel your health slowly deteriorating and your tools feel heavier than they did.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Blocking
data.value: You are blocking incoming attacks and it is consuming a lot of stamina.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Bleeding
data.value: You are bleeding! You must bandage your wounds in order to heal.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Poisoned
data.value: You are poisoned! You must take an antidote in order to heal.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_Stun
data.value: You can't move or fight back!

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_ArmWoundLeft
data.value: Your accuracy is decreased and blocking now is tiresome.

data.name: Description_StatusEffect_ArmWoundRight
data.value: Your swinging speed and crossbow reloading are slower.

data.name: Description_Effects_Tea
data.value: Your health regeneration is temporarily boosted.

data.name: Description_Effects_JuiceFruit
data.value: Your stamina regeneration is temporarily boosted.

data.name: Description_Effects_BreadSweetened
data.value: Your building speed is temporarily boosted.

data.name: Description_Effects_BreadSpiced
data.value: Your tree cutting, shoveling, and mining abilities are temporarily boosted.

data.name: Description_Effects_Bandage
data.value: Your health regeneration is temporarily boosted.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Pumpkin
data.value:
Pumpkins are orange and grown on vines. They can be picked only when they are fully grown. Eating raw pumpkins satisfies hunger, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Pumpkin vines can be found growing in grassy areas of the following biomes: Steppe Tropical Forest

data.name: Description_Consumables_Cabbage
data.value:
Cabbages are green, round and grow on the ground. Eating raw cabbages satisfies hunger by a small amount, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Cabbages grow in grassy areas of the following biomes: Steppe Tropical Forest

data.name: Description_Consumables_Berries
data.value:
Berries are red and grow on bushes. They can be picked only when they are fully grown. Eating raw berries satisfies hunger by a small amount, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Berry bushes can be found in forested areas in the following biomes: Tundra Temperate Forest Steppe Tropical Forest Sandy Desert

data.name: Description_Consumables_Herbs
data.value:
Herbs are blue and grow on tall, thin stalks. Eating raw herbs satisfies hunger by a small amount, but it negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Herb plants can be found in the following biomes: Tundra Temperate Forest Steppe Tropical Forest

data.name: Description_Consumables_Mushrooms
data.value:
Mushrooms are white and brown and grow in small groups on the ground. Eating raw mushrooms satisfies hunger by a small amount, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Mushrooms can be found in forested areas in the following biomes: Tundra Temperate Forest Steppe

data.name: Description_Consumables_Roots
data.value:
Roots are dark brown and grow close to the ground. Eating raw roots satisfies hunger by a small amount, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Roots can be found in the following biomes: Tundra Steppe Tropical Forest Rocky Desert Sandy Desert

data.name: Description_Consumables_Meat
data.value: Meat can be harvested from dead animals. Eating raw meat satisfies hunger, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.

data.name: Description_Consumables_FruitsOpuntia
data.value:
Edible fruits from the opuntia cactus. These pink fruits grow on the cactus body which grows in desert biomes. Eating raw cactus fruit satisfies hunger by a small amount, but also negatively affects your well-being. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.
Opuntia cactuses can be found in the following biomes: Rocky Desert Sandy Desert

data.name: Description_Consumables_HodgePodge
data.value: Hodge Podge, also known as Hot Pot, is produced by throwing whatever you find into a pot and cooking it. Nutritionally diverse, hodge podge provides a decent amount of food and slowly raises your well-being.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Salad
data.value: Salad is produced by cooking vegetables and fruits together. Refreshing and nutritional, salad provides a decent amount of food.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Bread
data.value: Bread is produced by baking flour. Healthy and wholesome, bread is a good source of nutrition. It provides a decent amount of food and slowly raises your well-being.

data.name: Description_Consumables_RoastMeat
data.value: Roast Meat is produced by cooking raw Meat. It has no effect on health but Juicy and rich in proteins, meat provides a decent amount of food and raises your well-being.

data.name: Description_Consumables_SoupWithBread
data.value: Soup with bread is produced by cooking vegetables and adding a bread together. It is highly nutritious, providing a lot of food and raising your well-being significantly.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Goulash
data.value: Goulash is produced by cooking meat, bread, and vegetables together. It is highly nutritious, providing a lot of food and raising your well-being significantly.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Tea
data.value: Tea is brewed from fresh herbs. It provides a temporary boost.

data.name: Description_Consumables_JuiceFruit
data.value: Fruit Juice is produced by squeezing the juice out of fruit. It provides a temporary boost.

data.name: Description_Consumables_BreadSpiced
data.value: Spiced Bread is made by taking some bread and adding some flavoring like herbs and mushrooms inside it. It's a good, hearty meal that not only provides a good amount of food but also provides a temporary boost.

data.name: Description_Consumables_BreadSweetened
data.value: Sweet Bread is made by taking some bread and some fruits, turning the fruits into jam, and adding it to the bread. It's a good, energizing meal that not only provides a good amount of food but also provides a temporary boost

data.name: Description_Consumables_Bandage
data.value: Bandages are crafted using linen and healing herbs. They temporarily, but significantly, improve the rate at which your health regenerates.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Mushroom_Soup
data.value: Mushroom Soup is produced by cooking mushrooms, roots, and berries together. It is highly nutritious and has moderate effect on hunger.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Roots_With_Shrooms
data.value: Roots with shrooms is produced by cooking roots, mushrooms, and herbs together. It is moderately nutritious and has large effect on hunger.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Shroomsteak
data.value: Shroom steak is produced by cooking roast meat, mushrooms, cabbage, and roots together. It is moderately nutritious and has moderate effect on hunger.

data.name: Description_Weapon_SwordRusted
data.value: This old sword is so rusty, that it can't be smelt into anything better than few metal parts.

data.name: Description_Weapon_CrossbowUltimate
data.value: Implemented for debug purposes, do not use.

data.name: Description_Block_TransmissionWoodSwitchWithFrame
data.value: This shaft transmits mechanical power from one place to another. It has a lever to switch upper gear to connect or disconnect mechanical systems on both ends.

data.name: Description_Tag_AxeCutting
data.value: Axes are used for chopping down trees and cutting them into logs.

data.name: Description_Tag_Pickaxe
data.value: Pickaxes are used for mining ores, stones, dirt and clay.

data.name: Description_Tag_Shovel
data.value: Shovels are used for digging in soft ground and for placing dirt. Shovels can be used with Landscape Stakes and Ropes to create flat ground and slopes.

data.name: Description_Tag_MeleeWeapon
data.value: Melee Weapons are used for fighting up close.

data.name: Description_Tag_RangedWeapon
data.value: Ranged Weapons are used for fighting at a distance.

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_World
data.value: World chat is shared by all, and the default channel. Usage: /world Hello fellow engineers! Synonyms: /w

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_System
data.value: The system channel is used for notifications and general messages. You cannot send messages.

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_Trade
data.value: The trade channel is used by those who wish to trade.

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_House
data.value: The house channel allows you to talk to those in your house. Unavailable until you join a house. Usage: /house Hello fellow house members! Synonyms: /h

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_Local
data.value: Local chat is only visible to those nearby, up to 200 meters distance. Usage: /local Hello fellow locals! Synonym: /l

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_Speak
data.value: Speak chat is only visible to those within the same range as voice chat, up to 30 meters distance. Usage: /speak Hello engineer next to me! Synonyms: /say, /s Emote: /me waves at their nearby friends.

data.name: Description_ChatChannel_Private
data.value: Private chat is for talking privately to one other player. Usage: /tell Playername Hello friend! Quick reply: "[KEY:ChatQuickReply]", /r, /reply message

data.name: Description_Item_Thatch
data.value: Rolls of thatch are used to build thatch roofs.

data.name: Description_ItemTag_PlantMatter
data.value: Any suitable material that can be used for thatching.

data.name: Description_Item_ToolLong
data.value: Any tools with long handles, such as plows or shovels.

data.name: Description_Tag_MeleeWeaponShort
data.value: Any short melee weapons, such as broken swords.

data.name: Description_Tag_RangedWeapon
data.value: Any ranged weapons, such as crossbows.

data.name: Description_ResearchNode_CivilianBlueprint
data.value: Engineer's guide to blueprint building. Learn how to turn blueprints into real constructions!

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint
data.value: Engineer's guide to blueprint building. Learn how to turn blueprints into real constructions!

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step01
data.value: Blueprint building lets you place blocks using a blueprint as a plan rather than placing the blocks individually. If you make a nice house or a good cart, you can make a blueprint and be able to construct it again. Get started with blueprint building by gathering resources for a Blueprint Control Block.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step01_Short
data.value:
Get started with blueprint building by gathering resources for a Blueprint Control Block.
See the quest journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for more information.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step02
data.value: A Blueprint Control Block can be crafted at the Crafting Table.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step03
data.value: Place the Blueprint Control Block near an area with enough clear space to build your blueprint next to it.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step04
data.value:
Access the Blueprint Control Block and choose a blueprint to build.
For this quest, choose a blueprint made of large blocks.
Use the controls below to position your blueprint. "[KEY:CubeRotateVerticalNeg]" or "[KEY:CubeRotateVerticalPos]" to rotate. Use "[KEY:MoveFurther]" and "[KEY:MoveCloser]" to change the distance.
Use "[KEY:ToolPrimary]" when you are ready to place it.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step04_Short
data.value:
Access the Blueprint Control Block and choose a blueprint to build.
Choose a blueprint made of large blocks.
See the journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for more information and for rotation and distance controls.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step05
data.value:
Access the Blueprint Control Block to see your blueprint information.
The resources panel shows all of the resources needed to build the blueprint. The Blueprint Progress panel shows the overall completion and how many incomplete blocks remain.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step05_Short
data.value:
Access the Blueprint Control Block to see your blueprint information.
See the journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for more detailed descriptions.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step06
data.value:
Large block blueprints are built one layer at a time to maintain structural integrity.
When you hammer a blueprint it will place as many blocks as possible on the currrent layer using the resources in your inventory and in nearby stockpiles. Build all of the blocks on the current layer to make the next layer available.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step06_Short
data.value:
Large block blueprints are built one layer at a time to maintain structural integrity.
See the journal ("[KEY:QuestLog]") for more information.

data.name: Description_Quest_CivilianBlueprint_Step07
data.value: Now that you have completed a layer the next layer is made available. Build each layer until the blueprint is finished to complete blueprint.

data.name: Description_Schematic_CivilianBlueprint
data.value: A fold-out guide with instructions for blueprint building.
